Look, I understand all the points, but there's one thing everyone always forgets. Bill is nothing more than an interdimensional, intergalactic entity. don't get me wrong he most powerful one in this matter. The power Discord holds over Bill Cipher is this: Bill is merely a being close to godlike power but Discord is a somewhat of god/lord. If you remember, Discord is a force of nature, the embodiment of chaos. And the more chaos there is, the stronger Discord becomes. Now guess who actually wants to plunge the world into chaos? Exactly, Bill. And that‚Äôs will be biggest and last mistake when facing Discord. Discord himself said he can do anything and absolutely everything, as long as there‚Äôs enough chaos. Bill Cipher may want to be a symbol of chaos, but Discord is chaos itself.

Important notes that I feel they conveniently glossed over in this DB  1. Comparing Grogar's bell to the 'unicorn hair spell' is like saying dynamite and a nuke are the same just cause they both cause explosions. One is a mystical relic designed for the sole purpose of *stealing* supernatural energy, the other was explicitly a single, limited spell to protect against 'weirdness'. Meaning of course something simply altered by a weirdness wave would be negated, but something like the bell would be able to absorb the spell itself and redirect it. (We see this with how the hench maniacs are also unaffected, just punched to submission but anything created by bill is effected) Which means, while the unicorn spell won't drain bill's powers, the bell which works against alicorns, and can contain the power of cosmic beings like discord *absolutely will*  2. While not doing chaotic things may weaken discord's soul, this doesn't mean he can't heal it, if anything is means the opposite. The more chaos there is, the stronger *he* is, this is why things like the elements of harmony are so dangerous. *Furthermore* its never stated that Bill can 'heal his soul' the examples shown have nothing to do with his soul being damaged. Or rather its more implied that, in the mindscape you can literally do whatever without restriction so being able to damage Discord's soul would be pointless at that point as he could also heal his soul in the mindscape. Bill also *needs* a physical body to warp reality, discord does not, so it feels like you're ignoring context.  3. Discord being the 'strongest being in MLP' is kinda ignoring a lot of context. Discord's magic is weird, but several characters have been shown able to resist or overpower him. Not to mention in terms of raw strength/potency, we can use the fact that during Twilight and Tirek's, battle. A suped up twilight was only just barely matched by a Tirek weilding the entirety of equestria's magic plus discord. Meaning that while Twilight and Cadence probably aren't nearly as strong as C and L, an alicorn's potency is at least equivalent to 1/4th all equestria *including discord*  4. building off the prior satement, we see in Equestria girls FG, (yes im sorry it's canon) that simply small fragments of equestrian magic is enough to turn a regular human (sci-twi) into a reality warping/destroying god who can rip open wounds in spacetime between dimensions. Which if you know how the mlp cosmology works... IS FING TERRIFYING...  5. Furthermore, where Bill requires you to make a deal with him to manipulate your soul, Discord does not, discord can warp time as much as he pleases. And as someone else pointed out, sufficiently powerful entities, (time baby) can interfere with bill's powers as long as they are alive.

I believe that this was still a Discord win, though he technically lost, since he saved Equestria and got the last laugh. Coldest exit I've ever seen on Death Battle.
If any of you are wondering what happened to Bill after Weirdmaggedon, the Book of Bill has the answer.    Turns out, the Axolotl, basically the supreme being in the Gravity Falls universe, answered Bill's prayer to save him though it would come at a cost, Bill's biggest and worst challenge yet, going to therapy. Yeah, not joking, he got put into an interdimensional insane asylum called the Theraprism until he could finally deal with his issues which he has a lot of. On his first day he tried to start a riot and break out which failed and earned him an indefinite sentence in the Theraprism. Despite how nice the place is, Bill couldn't handle it and played his last trump card to get him outta there, he wrote a book and sent it to Stanford Pines, begging to be let out in exchange for Bill's autobiography. After a brief laughing session with his family at the knowledge of Bill's nightmare being therapy and that he had to write a book begging for help, Ford and the Pines decided to chuck the book into a dimensional rift and make it someone else's problem, namely us since the Book of Bill is now in our universe.

14:26 where that bow tie at
Bro actually turned him into a Dorito
Definitely my favorite Death Battle, and not just because I'm a huge Gravity Falls fan and psyched to see it finally make an appearance. The choreography and music, the plotting of the battle, the characterization of two chaotic cosmic overlords, it's all just... *chef's kiss*.  However, I think Bill was actually overestimated a bit in the analysis, though in practice it wouldn't have made a difference since Discord still had no solid means of killing him. Specifically, Wiz and Boomstick keep saying that Bill can "damage and/or regenerate spirits," using Dreamscaperers as an example. I believe this to be inaccurate. The versions of the twins, Soos, and even Bill himself present in Stan's mind during that episode are not their spirits or souls or whatever, but merely psychic avatars, which is why having a hole in their respective chests(?) did not affect either Dipper or Bill in the slightest, and why, once they were aware of it, the humans were just as powerful as Bill and able to directly attack him.  This is not comparable to Bill ripping out Dipper's soul in Sock Opera, since in that case they had explicitly made a deal which Bill was able to interpret as permission to remove Dipper's soul from his body. Similarly, Ford made an extremely open-ended deal, giving Bill unfettered access to his mind, with the only limitation being that Bill could only take direct control of his body while it was unconscious. This allowed Bill to do such things as alter Ford's vocabulary (replacing the word "burden" with "sea otter") and memories (made him temporarily forget his family, whole life, and even his name just to prove that he could), or cause him excruciating pain without inflicting actual physical damage (though he did plenty of that as well). The point is that Bill can't directly interact with or permanently alter someone's mind or soul without their permission given in a formal deal. Nor are the events of Dreasmscaperers comparable to Bill's defeat in Stan's mind during the finale, for both the same reason (they'd made a deal) and the fact that Bill's "soul" can clearly be seen exiting his body as it turns to stone, in much the same way as when he removed Dipper's earlier on in the show. At that point, since Bill actually HAD a physical form, he couldn't enter another's mind without leaving it, thus leaving himself vulnerable to spiritual attack. In terms of how this would affect the battle, Bill wouldn't be able to directly interact with or destroy Discord's spirit as was shown unless a deal was made that allowed him to do so. However, since Discord has no means of permanently harming Bill either, the stalemate would continue indefinitely. Discord would recognize this and enact the same longer-term plan he did in the battle, luring Bill back through the Rift long enough for it to close and trap both of them. The only difference is it would end with both Discord and Bill trapped in the Nightmare Realm, with the latter likely torturing the former for all eternity... or at least until Discord either gives up and joins Bill's Henchmaniacs (thus making a deal to be subservient to him) or gives up and allows Bill to destroy him permanently. So... Bill still wins, just in a way that would be really hard to depict onscreen.
this is so cool its seems like its the way it would actually go if it was a real thing

Hello recent commenter, here's why Bill won and why:  Note: This episode was released prior to Book of Bill and all content after that. It was debatable yet leaning in Bill's favour at the time of release, and is massively skewed towards Bill now. The following is based on our current information.  Strength/Durability: Discord should be around Multiversal+ (destroying infinite universes) or possibly even Low Complex Multiversal - 5-D (destroying a plane so far beyond a single (or infinite) timeline that it's considered a mathematically higher infinity) due to scaling above entities capable of threatening a plane containing infinite dream-realities. Meanwhile, Bill in their physical form should be around Hyperversal - 12-D (This is Low Complex Multiversal, but several layers higher) due to their mere existence perpetuating The Rift which connected Gravity Falls' main universe with The Nightmare Dimension (which is effectively a realm in-between all others, including realities that are of higher/lower spatial dimensions, such as the infamous 7-11 dimensional ones). Bill takes this.  Speed: Both can reach Immeasurable speeds (speeds breaking the speed formula), however Discord's is limited to his flight considering he showed a single instance of flying backwards in time, meanwhile Bill has had full even fights with entities like The Time Baby, who actively view time as akin to distance. Both are virtually equal, but Bill's hands are faster.  Intelligence: Bill... I probably shouldn't need to explain much.   Hax: Discord's most noteworthy hax are his concept-reliant immortality, his ability to regenerate from purely a spirit, being able to alter the story and existence erasure. Bill's most noteworthy include: concept-reliant immortality, his ability to regenerate purely from a spirit, being able to alter narratives, his entire existence being paradoxical and being angry causing his hax to become layered (meaning they can bypass resistances). As for who can bypass whose, Bill's entire existence being paradoxical would make him untouchable to Discord's attempts to destroy their concept meanwhile the opposite isn't the case, Bill can also destroy Discord's soul meanwhile...again...Discord can't due the same due to Bill's spirit not conventionally existing. If Bill ever achieves his physical form, his abilities just get stronger in potency...and if he gets angry, then nearly all of his abilities would be able to bypass Discord's resistances, so he could just turn Discord into a mindless frog, seal his soul in a sentence or grant him a career in S&P (a fate worse than death). IN SHORT: Bill has what Discord has, only more and can evade Discord's form of it.  Hax 2: Yeah, Bill also CAN prevent Discord from coming back due to him being able to eat and control concepts.  Notable Weaknesses: Discord is overconfident and can be erased if he acts too orderly. Bill works on some rules for his mind-entering and possession, his eye is shockingly weak, synthesized music hurts him, erasing him from memory forces him to get the Axolotl to resurrect him - something that'd take too long and give Discord the win. Overall, Bill's are far easier to exploit however Discord's - which Bill can exploit via their powers - have more damning consequences.  Overall, Bill just about edged out Discord when this first came out with the only arguable thing being abilities and Bill's higher-end scaling. Now, Bill solidly has the means to exceed and even perfectly take out Discord :P

If anyone is curious about that random strings of letters at Bill's descriptions, here are the solutions I found      - "A HDU'B VJXU DMZL KYWVRWR LPVXG" is a Vigenere Cipher with the Keyword "SEPHIROTH" and returns "I DON'T EVEN LIKE CHICKEN WINGS" - "VOVEVM WVVA MFGA SZS" is most likely(?) an Affine Cipher and returns "ELEVEN DEEZ NUTZ HAH" with A=25, B=25 (I'm not too sure tbh, but this was the closest match I could find in a reasonable time)

Discord may have lost against Bill Cipher, but at least he saved his friends and all of Equestria. üôåüèΩ
Discord is a more powerful character than Bill Cipher.  While both are incredibly powerful beings with the ability to manipulate reality, Discord's powers are more extensive and versatile. He can control the very fabric of existence, shape reality to his will, and even transcend the limits of time and space. Bill Cipher, on the other hand, is primarily focused on chaos and deception, and his powers are more limited in scope. The popular fan theory that Bill Cipher is a manifestation of Discord is further evidence of Discord's superior power. If Bill were more powerful, he would likely be the one controlling Discord, not the other way around.

This ultimately came down to "Which character has a lose condition?", any weaknesses they may have. Bill Cipher, from the sound of it (haven't watched his show), really had no weaknesses aside from the Stanford sacrifice scene. Discord, I've seen plenty of Friendship is Magic, and I can recall a good few that Bill might be able to replicate.  - Elements of Harmony for one thing, major MacGuffin that turned him to stone. Either straight petrification, or a more specific type of magic rooted in the user's bonds with the other bearers. - As Death Battle stated, Tirek absorbed Discord's magic, although only after getting strong enough from eating enough pony magic. If Bill has a way to sap away magic, easy win condition, especially since he's already at least on par in power level. - In the absence of chaos, Discord can fade out of existence. Potentially just straight existence erasure would end Discord for good. - While Discord helped in infiltrating the Changeling kingdom, it was built around a crystal that stops any magic but a Changeling's. This includes blocking teleportation within its area of effect, and any summons will get deleted upon entering the area of effect. Arguably that could affect Bill too if he tried using the material, but he may have physical means to work around it (like with the unicorn hair in Gravity Falls).

I disagree, Discord is not "dead". Discord is the embodiment of disharmony and as long as chaos exists, Discord exists. Bill on the other hand, relies on folks remembering it and folks have to keep people playing in order to survive. So this battle is a DRAW.  HOWEVER from a tactical standpoint, Discord won. His understanding of Bill allowed him to let the events play out and having Bill think he's in control. The "locks" on Discord being "trapped" in Bill's grip was only temporary and were released when the Doritio loosened his grip after Discord popped. Discord's own chaos abilities weren't nulled, it only meant that he could slip out from a tight grip. The Chaos would allow him to survive but as say a mist or an atomized and gaseous amount of Discord. The caveat is Discord is stuck there too because if he slips, out Bill can to. All-in-all Bill is defeated since his goal was not achieved again. Discord can only be released when Bill is released. And Discord knows when he will be out, he just gotta wait it out until the next fool shakes Bill's hand.

Another interesting detail about Bill's win here and loss in gravity falls is one core difference: He *isn't* trapped in this fight. In the case of Gravity Falls, he is trapped inside of Stanly's mind due to it being reased, and he currently existed onpy in spirit form.  In this fight, he never has to leave his physical body, which is equally as capable of spiritual damage to his spiritual body. Though his spirit is trapped as Discord attempts to delete him, the fact that his physical body is still actionable is ultimately the trump card ‚Äî as there is no way to stall Bill inside his own mind. There never would've been enough time to erase Bill like this

Basically, this fight is between pranksters (Bill) vs Jokesters (Discord).
Technically, Discord is the literal personification of chaos and discord, and this means that as long as chaos and discord exist, he is immortal. The only way to kill him is to destroy all chaos and discord and create a multiverse of pure harmony, etc. But that is logically impossible, after all, the simple act of being alive is already "chaos." so much so that in the show we see that the only possible way to deal with and defeat discord is by sealing or containing it precisely because it is impossible to destroy it Even if you destroy all the magic that exists including his, he still won't die because as we see in the new generation, even without magic, Discord didn't die and continued to be immortal, living all this time without his magic. So logically speaking, Bill wouldn't have won or defeated even if he gave up, the discord body would only be temporary and he would simply reassemble himself, revive himself or etc. discord is an immortal character with the power to distort and play with reality as he sees fit and if he were really serious and had 100% intention to kill and destroy everything the literal entire multiverse would be vaporized discord is basically the closest thing to a god we have the more chaos and discord there is, the more powerful he will be considering the amount of chaos and discord bill cipher has created discord canonically would have the power to end bill with a snap of his fingers discord is basically a god, a deity, while bill cipher would merely be a mortal individual from the second dimension who, by sheer luck, gained a little extra power to alter the third dimension Meanwhile, Discord would have the power to access and interfere with practically all dimensions the world of my little pony has almost no chaos and discord being a kingdom and dimension with harmony that's why discord is limited However, if discord were to go to a dimension of pure chaos or in this case where cipher itself makes the entire dimension into pure chaos and discord, discord's power would reach divinity levels and, depending on the situation, even reach a level superior to the power of a god. even the most powerful objects and relics that exist cannot destroy or kill him unless they are able to seal and contain him. power of friendship? elements of harmony? like all other things is completely incapable of getting rid of discord permanently Is not even close, for Bill, they had to invent a weakness for Discord, we are prettending that destroying Discord "Spirit" is the same that destroying his "soul" or even destroying him as a concept, the example they provide didnt even work like that, Discord body was exiled from the school, not destroyed, that is why he came back as a Ghost, implying that his body is over there in some part of Equestria, meaning that Discord Ghost and body can be is 2 parts at the same time, which is not that crazy because Discord showed already having multiple bodies at the same time. And in a top of that we are prettending that Bill have Soul regeneretion when the set up was in a dream, so, Dipper have soul regeneration too? He regenerated too in that example, Why we are implying that is soul manipulation instead of dream manipulation? The only beigns Bill destroyed inside Stan Mind was fictional characters from Mabel dreams, not real people. Prettinding Bill having Soul Manipulation and regeneration is very obvious right? But pretending Discord could regenerate his spirit is too crazy? He could just regenerate his physical form whenever he want, in the MLP episode he doesn't because his body was exiled from the shcool. The real Discord Weakness are power stealing abilites, the elements of harmony, and exile powers (Which should be strong enought to exile more that just his physical form), I don't see Bill with access to any of that. The more boring one would be forcing Discord be normal, which is the more effective one agaisnt Discord, but doesnt work in this set up, because weirdmageddon would prevent Discord from disappearing. Another dumb thing they compare the capabilities of the Unicorn Hair with the Grogar Bewitching Bell, which obviously are not at the same level, we are comparing a Shield which passive feat is stealing powers from a cursed totem, not even a monster or Bill Minion, with Grogar Bell which has the feat of stealing powers of beigns at the level of Discord and the princesses, the Bell was the only Bill wincon, because he could stole it from Discord and using agaisnt him. We could claim that Bill can resist power stealing from Grogar Bewithcing Bell if you wish, but there is not information of Bill having that resistance at that level. Discord in the other side, could Teleport Bill to somewhere else, like in the fight, or hitting Bill with a move of the same level of the Quantum destabilizer, which is claiming strong enough to defeating Bill, Discord could forced Bill inside of the mind of one of his clones and destroying himself. Bill weaknesses are very clear and in more disposition to Discord exploit it. THAT'S EXACTLY WHAT I'VE BEEN SAYING THIS WHOLE TIME. They even dug through the trash just to say that Bill can eliminate souls and regenerate his own, even though the guy doesn't even have Conceptual Manipulation to affect Discord. Also, they compared the Empowerment of both and said that they cancel each other out.  It doesn't make sense, Bill's Empowerment isn't even close to Discord's, Bill was gaining power for many days since Weirdmageddon had started and yet he was still hurt by physical objects and received a beating from Shacktron.  While Discord with just a little chaos freed himself from the prison of the Elements of Harmony, and even, at the time where he was imprisoned, he could cause enough chaos to the point that he became unstoppable even when he was turned into stone.  Even if they were right and their Empowerment has the same power, their logic still fails, because Discord would be being empowered by his own chaos and the chaos of Bill's Weirdmageddon, gaining MUCH MORE power, and if all that fails, he only has to go to Chaosville and replenish his energy to continue the battle. And well, I won't mention the fact that they were belittling Discord's abilities, to the point where they said Discord's Plot Manipulation wouldn't work against Bill, or that Discord couldn't just manipulate Bill's mind. They even said that Bill with his Precognition could anticipate Discord, even though Discord is immune to precognition since his power does not follow the laws of cause and effect and they do not follow any logic. They were also exaggerating Bill's "omniscience" and knowledge, being that in the series he was shown to have very stupid attitudes and decisions, and Discord also has omniscience and precognition due to all the control he has over space-time and has access to damn plot.  I loved this episode of Death Battle, but they didn't research Discord's power very well, otherwise they would know that he has a clone of himself in his own dimension, so if Discord dies, he simply has to pass his consciousness to the clone. In that case, the real winner of the Death Battle should have been Discord by BFRing Bill to the Nightmare Realm and having a spare Discord in Chaosville.

Carmelized sugar retains heat long enough to survive a trip through the air and can give you terrible third degree burns damaging multiple layers of skin, flesh, and even nerves. you know bills mad when he shifts from 64-bit into animation
You know... it still annoys me that they show Bill doing things he clearly couldn't do. Bill SAID he could do some of the things that were shown in that fight. Bill has never actually shown any major powers that put him anywhere near Discord's league. I'd say he's nowhere near the level of The Collector from The Owl House. All of his best tricks were shown when he was in Soos' or Gideon's head. In reality... he was able to grow as big as a house, shoot lasers, turn people into statues, and create Mabel's tiny rainbow kingdom.   I mean, it's still a lot, but in hindsight... you'd expect more from all the hype, wouldn't you say? Bill is presented as smart, but he's being fooled by a bunch of kids and old people. Bill is presented as having unlimited power, but in the end, he looks like nothing more than a rich magician.  I don't understand why he's considered powerful when all that stands behind the legend of his limitless power is his own words. The words of a notorious liar - just a reminder.   I don't argue that within the framework of the Gravity Falls universe, in which every character is limited by human capabilities and no one has been able to show even slightly impressive destructive potential, Bill really does look like an all-powerful god. But compared to all the creatures he's often put in the same league with? The guy looks like nothing more than a child whose lie went too far, but who is simply afraid to admit that he lied about his powers, already surrounded by guys who can kill him with their minds.

I disagree with the result, and here's why. The whole idea of the KO was that Discord would make himself into a spirit in an attempt to imitate Stanley's trick with the memory gun. This was what allowed Bill to erase him, as he was only a ghost.  However, Discord's the manipulation guy. He's a genius. That's his entire shtick, as seen in The Return of Harmony when he plays the mane six right into his hands. While normally carefree, this time Fluttershy is in danger, invoking seriousness such as in To Where And Back Again, where he didn't hesitate to try and snap his fingers and instantly fix everything. Bill needs to be in the mindscape, Discord going into Bill's is not the same. I don't think he would be that dumb in the given scenario.  So what do I think would've really happened? Since Discord says in the fight he's watched Gravity Falls, I believe he would've simply gone to the scene where Ford's about to shoot the quantum destabilizer, which would've killed Bill for good had it hit him in the eye (in the book of Bill, he himself admits it's a weakness of his), snatched Ford to the present moment and aimed him at bill.  Lastly, whether Bill can or not actually eradicate souls from existance is debatable. The guys in the footage shown weren't actual souls, but Mabel's imaginary friends. And I'd also argue Bill is unable to directly kill. He knew Dipper was a threat to Mabel's bubble. If he was really that all-powerful, wouldn't Bill simply have warped Dipper out of existence? No, he needed to put Gideon on the case. And later we see him pissed off and needing to actually chase the two puny human kids down, when he was pissed off and surely just wanted them dead.

13:25 where the fight starts
Let me preface this by saying that I do not care who actually wins or loses here. It means nothing to me. I only come here because this video adds to the pile of Bill Cipher wanks.  Apparently Bill is even weaker than he is commonly portrayed by powerscale(rs) wankers thanks to new info from the book of bill.   First things are a list of his weaknesses. His second weakness is literally wearing tinfoil because it blocks him from going inside your head.  The next one is Fiddleford's mind, which is later elaborated through a backstory from when bill decided to enter the crazy old man's mind. From what bill described, fiddleford's mind was collapsing like a neutron star and he notes how he couldn't decode what the heck his mind has turned into. Then bill recalls how he was struck by a 'single spark from memory inferno' like laser through butter, a kind of pain that wasn't hilarious.  That experience has legit given Bill trauma and he even begged the reader to destroy it, and would reward anyone who could do it.  From this it is correct to say bill can't handle the pressure of a collapsing neutron star and thus the inside of a black hole, and neither could he decode a black hole, so not so much of an "all knowing triangle".   There are definitely more embarrassing weaknesses but before you could see them, bill lifts up the page in anger and then forces you to read (some pages of) the Great Gatsby. This is by far the most evil thing he has done.   Forwards to his backstory, we learn that hiis eye was gifted with a vision that allowed him to see 3D things, but the part about how he destroyed his world was censored by a bunch of static mess. But to fill the gaps, imma borrow from someone else, there's "a theory going around, that stated that Bill destroyed his dimension by literally changing their perspective. Changing their positioning from vertical to horizontal, as seen in his eye in the weirdmageddon episodes, so that everyone could see the stars. Well that scene isn‚Äôt the only evidence for this happening. As we know from the website, Bill has an odd phobia of Venetian blinds. What do Venetian blinds do? They go from vertical to horizontal (or the other way).  The burning part might be because by changing the position of his world, they were now in the direct rays of their sun."  So basically, he only ""burned"" his own home dimension by shifting its plain, facing them toward the sun and burning the world to ash. Bill wanted everyone else to see the 3rd dimension, and they all died due to his action. The world ended, they all broke into static.  Oh yeah there's also a part during his later "adult" years where he stated that the edge of reality was getting closer and closer to his nightmare realm every second. Bill states that "anyone who wasn't hunkered down in a stable dimension when this edge passed would be instantly erased from reality". His friends were scared of this and Bill had to set out to invade other dimensions to survive and continue the chaos.   This indicates that Bill cannot survive universe ending events and he cannot "reality-warp" the event out of it or to make it disappear either.

So, we now know what happened to Bill after the events of Weirdmageddon! Spoilers for the Book of Bill: - - - Bill pleaded to the Axolotl for another chance at life, feigning remorse for his crimes.* He thought the Axolotl would fall for this ploy, but he didn't expect the fate it decided for him. The Axolotl gave Bill what he hated the most, as well as what he needed the most: Therapy. It sent Bill's half-dead soul to a place called the Theraprism, where malevolent entities are rehabilitated before being reincarnated into a new form. Bill wrote the Book of Bill during the Therapeutic Journaling Arts and Crafts Hour, in an attempt to get someone to shake his statue's hand and summon him once again. Did it work? Well, that depends... Wanna make a deal?  *This might not have been completely a lie. Bill was born in a 2-dimensional world very similar to the story Flatland. Everyone there was a geometric shape only capable of seeing 1-dimensional images of 2-dimensional space, like how we can only see 2-dimensional images of 3-dimensional space. However, Bill was born with a rare defect in his eye that allowed him to see the third dimension. Much like in Flatland, it was forbidden to talk about higher dimensions. Nobody else knew what Bill meant when he was talking about the stars or "looking up." Bill was frustrated by these flat beings with flat dreams, so he tried to liberate his dimension so everyone could see what he saw. There was screaming, burning, and something about the sitcom Family Matters, until only Bill remained, covered in blood. Bill could have repressed this memory and might truly believe that he liberated his dimension and that everyone was thankful for it.

In this narrative, Discord cunningly anticipates his own defeat, understanding that his chaotic essence ensures his eventual return. His plan revolves around diverting Bill's attention, leading him away from Equestria while making Bill believe he‚Äôs on the verge of victory. The true genius of Discord‚Äôs strategy is revealed in the end: by allowing Bill to focus solely on killing him, Discord manipulates the battle to take place outside of Equestria, ultimately trapping Bill in his home dimension. Though Discord seemingly perishes, the victory is hollow for Bill, as the real triumph lies in Discord‚Äôs ability to protect Equestria and ensure that chaos‚Äîand thus Discord himself‚Äîwill eventually return.  Discord is inherently more powerful than Bill Cipher because his connection to chaos is limitless and bound by no rules. Bill, despite his reality-warping abilities, is driven by a need for control and domination, which ultimately restricts him. In the fight, Bill might have initially gained the upper hand, using his knowledge of the multiverse and his cunning tricks to challenge Discord. However, Discord‚Äôs strength lies in his unpredictability‚Äîsomething Bill could never fully anticipate or counter.   The creators of the video might claim that Bill won because he seemingly killed Discord, but this interpretation misses the larger picture. Discord knew his "defeat" was temporary, a necessary part of his plan to lure Bill away from Equestria and trap him. Bill‚Äôs singular focus on victory made him an easy target for Discord‚Äôs ruse, blinding him to the larger game Discord was playing. In essence, while Bill might have won the battle, Discord won the war by ensuring Bill's confinement and the safety of Equestria, knowing that his chaotic nature would eventually bring him back.

5:04 and 17:32 uhh forgot to mention: Bill fighting a house with unicorn hair isn't actually a feat of power nullification resistance since unicorn hair cannot nullify the power at all, that is taken out of context, in fact one of its functions is to reverse the weirdness caused by Weirdmaggedon.  Reverse rarity ‚â† Nullify Power. That's why the totem that had been controlled by Weirdmaggedon's weirdness returned to normal, the only reason it didn't affect Bill is because Bill is the one who caused that weirdness and you simply can't return Bill to his normal state. Those who defend this idea forget the fact that Bill could not even bypass the unicorn's shield with any of his powers, which shows that he does not have any type of resistance to it. Assuming that the unicorn's shield really really really can nullify the power, it is still not something impressive, we are talking about it affecting a random totem, it is evident that it could not affect Bill Cipher who is infinitely more powerful... unless you believe that it could have done it. edit: the unicorn hair literally his special function is to be immune to Bill's weirdness, that's why it is not affected by waves of madness or Bill's powers, if it could drain the power of others it would literally do it with any creature that comes across, like the Henchmaniacs who btw were not affected by this. And if that's the case, you're once again compared a random totem with Bill Cipher.  Edit 2: 17:36(on black box): Ford stated or said "The rift is shattered. Bill's world is spiling into ours and every minutes his powers grow stronger" He said "every minutes" not "every seconds".

Actually, Discord was actively weakening himself during this battle. By returning the ponies and Equestria to their rightful states, he was actively invoking and restoring Order, the opposite of Chaos. Wow, I didn't catch Bill's line at 15:15 "Tell Jean-Luc his show's worse than Code of Honor"  John De Lancie (The voice of Discord in MLP) plays Q in Star Trek: The Next Generation, another nigh omnipotent being. Jean-Luc refers to Jean-Luc Picard, the Captain in that show who frequently butts heads with Q, (or just facepalms in his presence.) You know, weird observation, but rewatching some of my favorite Death Battles...THIS is the first time one of the combatants has cared more about the world they were fighting on than winning the fight itself. Like, seriously, this is the first time when both combatants CAN destroy a planet without blinking an eye, and one of them sacrifices the fight, in order to spare the world they're on.  No one else in this series has given enough of a dang to preserve the world if it gives them even a slight disadvantage in the fight. Not even people like Superman, who, barring certain film versions, does NOT let himself go all out if it will endanger anyone else.  Not sure what that says about the fight itself, but Pony characters tend to make this series do weird things. From Rainbow Dash eating souls, Twilight evolving mid fight, or Pinkie Pie throwing a party that defeats the hosts...neat.

14:52  IS THAT AMONGUS
I mean‚Ä¶ feels a bit unfair, even if I‚Äôm biased. You note that Discord is more powerful than anyone in his universe, INCLUDING a villain who‚Äôd threaten the multiverse given time, and Bill too fits under that rule. Also got to consider, if Discord could figure out the unicorn hair rule, which is highly likely because a third of the population of Equestria is straight up unicorns, he‚Äôd have an immediate way of stopping Bill‚Äôs attacks. Sure it can‚Äôt drain Bill of his powers but something which can stop all of his attacks dead? Seems fairly useful to me.
I don't think that Bill can win this, tbh. My reasoning is as follows; 1: Discord's lordship of the chaotic realm gives him control of chaos on a multiversial level and thus Bill, being an incarnation of weirdness (which is ultimately chaos) would be subject to Discord's power. (No, Bill could not take it from him as everything he does is planned out) 2: Bill is incredibly weak to physical attacks, which Discord is not above doing, one of his standard tricks is 'being behind someone and petting or otherwise dancing atop them. It's incredibly reasonable to believe Discord could catch Bill off guard and punch him to destroy him as Dipper almost did and had to be stopped. 3: The Unicorn spell preventing Bill from interacting with anything was *never* broken by Bill and could be easily instituted by Discord as he can simply see when that was happening (as he's nigh omniscient) and turn a copy of himself into a unicorn to complete it without any issues around his prime self, choosing only to engage with Bill in ways that Discord wins. 4: Bill never reached a higher-dimensional state, is outrun by children using a grappling hook for several minutes when he gets angry, and is incredibly easy to get angry. 5: Discord could equally likely summon, brainwash and use the zodiac circle that was setup and known to be able to defeat Bill. It would not be hard for him to make that happen. 6: Discord's only ever defeated by two things: having his powers drained (which Bill is never shown to be able to do except through deals) and a universe tier artifact that exists to erase weirdness/chaos and set things back to order. Bill is not capable of either of those conditions, but Discord is more than capable of measuring up to multiple of Bill's defeat conditions. 7: Discord IS shown to not take things seriously, but he's also shown to recognize a threat when he sees it. The only reason he believed himself immune to the Elements of Harmony is because he believed he'd actually defeated them. Bill's Arrogance won't allow him to play weak like that, so Discord would know exactly how serious to take this fight. He's *deadly* serious when referring to things that matter to him. He gets an edge in his voice that's clearly detectable even from his first scene with Princess Celestia. 8: Bill was almost defeated by an energy blast from a gun that Ford put together. The only reason he wasn't is that Dipper and Ford were spooked by an eyebat and missed, hitting Bill's hat instead. If Bill is capable of being defeated by a weapon made of mortal artifice, and Discord's seen the show as the episode indicates, then Discord can replicate that weapon endlessly and fill every single space in space with the particles that would blast Bill without a second thought, given that he has complete, unbound control over what is anywhere at any time (which Bill is NOT shown to have, not really).  9: Even within this episode, there's no explanation as to why Bill didn't simply die to Discord physically punching his spirit in his own mind. I don't understand how you can say that wouldn't work for Discord when it worked for Stan. Stan the *infinitely less powerful* human. The logic seems to be that 'because Bill didn't have tunnel-vision, he can't die to that', but that isn't what's shown, either in this episode or in Gravity Falls. Bill didn't just escape his own mind and stop Discord from winning that way here, nor is it shown that if he hadn't been focused on Ford Stan's punch wouldn't have killed him. A single punch should have ended it once Discord went inside, and Bill should have had no way of stopping Discord from going inside, since we do not see him stop someone from using that on him ever, and Bill should have had no way of stopping Discord punching his lights out because Bill, even with his physical form, struggled to stop Dipper's jumping punch, which still advanced on him a while before it was stopped and Dipper was forced back.   Bill is strong, but he's much more limited than Discord is. Weirdness Magnetism is the least of what Discord can *easily* achieve, and that foiled Bill completely. Discord (especially in the comics, but even in the show) is beyond anything Bill has to offer where he is actually stopped. Mabel's Prison Bubble is infinitely less complex than Discord's chaotic realm and is stated by Bill to be the most dangerous thing he's ever conceived.  Discord is simply not going to lose this, and the Elements of Harmony are going to stomp in a Unicorn spell bubble with Discord behind them at worst.  Bill WOULD have been able to defeat Discord IF Bill actually succeeded in his plans and became higher dimensional. But as was, stuck in 3d, still subject to laws of weirdness magnetism, with a strong aversion of physical force and multiple means of defeat achievable by average (albeit intelligent) humans... Bill has no chance of ever defeating Discord, not how we see him in the comics nor how we see him in the show. All of Bill's strongest capabilities required him to make deals to access them, and even then none of them were remotely as strong as Discord's, at the level he got to.  Also, Bill never actually killed Time Baby. Time Baby was stated to regenerate in the post-credits information.
What an ending I thought the loser had won until they explained it though

14:54 batim flower
Discord can easily win by doing one thing. Snap his fingers to create another dimension, send Bill to that other dimension, then snap his fingers to destroy that dimension.  If Bill is in another realm when that realm is destroyed, such as a mind, or another dimension, Bill is destroyed with it. While both characters are extremely overpowered, Bill does have limitations. Hence why he was stopped by unicorn hair (which Discord can conjure up at a whim), he was stopped by the laws of weirdness that kept him contained in Gravity falls, which is a form of science and reality he has been shown to be unable to fully warp. He also struggles breaking through interdimensional barriers.  Discord does not. have these limitations. Without some way of draining his power, or the magic of friendship, there is nothing Bill can do that Discord can't. But there are multiple things Discord can do that Bill can't. And one of the things that Bill is limited in is his power over the multiverse. Something Discord has full control over.  If these two got into a death battle and we asking who would win with brute force, Discord 100%. BUT if we are not in a death battle scenario and are in a situation where Bill can trick Discord into joining his side with the intent of destroying him later once he gets a hold of something like Grogar's bell, Bill Cypher would win 100%.

Truly, I think I have to disagree. Discord is quite literally a force of nature, and while Bill‚Äôs range of powers is broader than Discord‚Äôs, I wouldn‚Äôt say that Discord is less strong. Discord draws power from chaos, and Weirdmageddon causes chaos. So while Bill draws power from Weirdmageddon as it progresses, so does Discord, but Bill doesn‚Äôt draw power from chaos itself, so anything chaotic that Discord did wouldn‚Äôt make Bill more powerful, but it would make himself more powerful. I also think you misread him psychologically, as I would consider his carefree nature another act, a representation of his need to cause chaos rather than his actual personality. I think that while he sometimes makes mistakes and can sometimes be overconfident, I think that deep down, at the height of his power he would pretend to act like this to gain an advantage. Appear weak when you are strong and strong when you are weak, after all. I also think that, much like Cypher never really died and will eventually be reincarnated, so too will Discord after he dies. Not because he prayed to an axolotl or anything, but simply because he is the physical incarnation of a force of nature in a world where many forces of nature are personified, such as the rising of the sun and moon, and to an extent the forces of harmony, and probably some more examples I‚Äôm forgetting. As long as chaos can exist, so too would Discord, in some capacity. His redemption arc, in my opinion, is meant to represent how chaos is not always evil, but rather it‚Äôs just natural. It‚Äôs neutral and impartial, and it‚Äôs up to us to work with the forces of change and surf the chaos of the universe rather than work against it and try to make everything un chaotic and unchanging. This is in contrast with Bill, who seems to represent someone who‚Äôs mastered the art of surfing the chaos, but for the express purpose of being evil, rather than working to better society or anything else that would be considered good. So I think that rather than fighting Discord directly, I think that Bill would try to manipulate Discord instead, again trying to manipulate chaos in his favor. In this regard, Bill‚Äôs main goal would be to remove Fluttershy from the equation (speaking of which, the friendship between Discord and Fluttershy can be explained by noting that nature is a primary example of chaos, and how it can be both good and bad, and Fluttershy has befriended pretty much all of nature, meaning that the personification of chaos would appreciate someone who understands and accepts chaos like Fluttershy, as her cottage is a perfect example of how all these chaotic elements with all the different species of animals that might normally rip each other apart can work in harmony, showcasing how harmony is not necessarily the opposite of chaos, rather it is the ability to use chaos to one‚Äôs advantage in order to create an ‚Äúorderly kind of chaos,‚Äù which I think would mean that as he furthers along his character development, Discord would be less and less affected by the Elements of Harmony), which as you could probably guess, would be Bill‚Äôs fatal mistake, an error comparable to unaliving John Wick‚Äôs Dog, and considering how Discord can break the 4th wall much easier than Bill can, he would have the capability to know all about Bill‚Äôs tactics and abilities, just like you alluded to. This would allow him to have any number of ways to beat Bill, but in typical Discord fashion, he would do it in the most chaotic and unpredictable way imaginable, making it nearly impossible for even Bill to see coming. So rather than the simple answer to the scenario you provided of having the Discord that Bill fought being a clone the entire time because if he knew that he was going to sacrifice himself then that‚Äôs the first thing he would do, even if it was in the heat of battle, he would be much more likely to do something completely different and unexpected, something that we could only begin to guess at. I‚Äôm open to discussion though, as I might just not know enough about Bill to understand how he could counter that.

15:13 "Tell Jean Luc his show is worse than Code of Honor!"  "Code of Honor" from the first season of Star Trek: The Next Generation is widely regarded as the absolute worst episode of the entire series, and deservedly so. While this episode was being made, the most recent season of Picard was season two, which was horrible. Saying it was even worse than Code of Honor is a massive insult, and since Picard season two featured a lot of Q, played by John de Lancie who also voices Discord, it's not only a fourth wall break but a multi-layered insult to Discord, his voice actor, and the show he most recently appeared on.  Bill not only won the fight, he also won the trash talking.

Black Hat vs Bill Cipher
I feel like you came up with the narrative for this fight before you did the research. Bill and Discord are evenly matched, but if Bill couldn't escape the magical containment of Gravity Falls, there is absolutely no way in hell that he should resist that magic-draining bell. Discord being empowered by chaos is way stronger and more effective than Bill being empowered by Weirdmageddon. And Discord goofing off is a non-factor when, like Bill, he has gotten serious against opponents when he knows how strong they are, and he's canonically aware of Gravity Falls.
The main difference is that Bill goes further than Discord and plays for keeps. Discord, regardless for how far he's gone, has never irreversibly broken Equestria. Bill, on the other hand, destroyed his home dimension by breaking the rules that held it together, yet refuses to accept he is at fault.

Been a while since I‚Äôve watched one of these, I didn‚Äôt know you guys had appearances now.
While I love this Death Battle - the animation, music, and voice acting is all incredible - the outcome sits...weirdly with me. I at first thought the winner was Discord by ring out (putting Bill in a situation where he could no longer continue the fight), but then the explanation goes on to give the win to Bill via destruction of Discord's spirit as "Discord has never shown regeneration from spiritual damage". Since when is the absence of evidence the evidence of absence? Discord has never shown spiritual regeneration because Discord has never *taken* spiritual damage. I don't really get how that shows a weakness anymore than his never being exposed to Kryptonite shows a vulnerability to Kryptonite.  The scene used to show Discord can be erased is quite misrepresented as well. Discord was fading away because of an absence of chaos, not because of any outside force wiping him out. By all indications, Discord just cannot die as long as chaos exists around him, which is a rather big problem for Bill given the Weirdmageddon he thrives on.  Still, the battle itself is a spot-on representation of both characters. Wouldn't change a thing about it! Just the final verdict drawn from it.
And poeple think the lich can beat discord and bill cipher no he can't üòÇüòÇüòÇ.
I like that this is a clash of "good and evil" between two gods basically, Discord is casually defending his friends, but clearly knows he very well might die in the process, so he distracts, diverts, annoys, and eventually loses, sure, but manages to screw Bill over in a major way in the end anyway. A lot of series would just have for example, Bill win 5 seconds in, establishing his power by beating the hero's big gun, worfing, but this pays a lot more respect to both sides. Discord is weaker, but he's not weak, he didn't win, but his death wasn't for nothing either, that's why I love this story so much, more could learn from it's example.

The narrative of this Death Battle is 11/10, undoubtedly your best, but the research is... incredibly shaky? Both Discord AND Bill underestimate their opponents but Discord also has a record of serious-ing up against actual threats, so there's no advantage to Bill there. There's no reason at all to assume the Bell wouldn't work on Bill because it's far more powerful that the unicorn-hair shield. Discord canonically knowing of Gravity Falls and Bill Cipher gives him a huge advantage, while Bill's 'kaleidascope vision' is from a Reddit AMA with Bill, so hardly a reliable source.

Death Battle got this one wrong. Discord is simply too powerful for Bill Cipher to handle.  Here are some facts supporting Discord:      Discord is a god of chaos, while Bill Cipher is just a demon. Gods are inherently more powerful than demons.     Discord is immortal, while Bill Cipher can be killed. Immortality is a huge advantage in a fight.     Discord has reality-warping powers, while Bill Cipher's reality-warping powers are limited. Discord can rewrite reality to his liking, while Bill Cipher can only make small changes.     Discord has the power to create and destroy entire universes, while Bill Cipher can only destroy universes. This means that Discord can create a new universe to fight in if Bill Cipher destroys the current one.     Discord has the power to control minds, while Bill Cipher does not. This means that Discord can easily defeat Bill Cipher by simply taking over his mind.  In addition to these facts, Discord is also much more intelligent and cunning than Bill Cipher. Bill Cipher is a bit of a goofball, while Discord is a master strategist. This would give Discord a significant advantage in a fight.  Overall, Discord is simply too powerful for Bill Cipher to defeat. Death Battle got this one wrong.  Here are some specific examples of how Discord's powers could be used to defeat Bill Cipher:      Discord could use his reality-warping powers to create a universe where Bill Cipher does not exist.     Discord could use his mind control powers to force Bill Cipher to do whatever he wants, including killing himself.     Discord could use his power to create and destroy universes to create a new universe where he is even more powerful than he is now.  No matter how you look at it, Discord is the victor in this battle. Death Battle needs to do a better job of researching their combatants before they make their videos.

Okay strange question but is there a sample of the track used for Bill's introduction or is it all original unreleased content?
Compared to other episodes of DB I seen, this one was just really top notch! The way the analysis is really Bill and Discord rambling at each other in the background.  But then comes the part where Discord says "I got friends, you remain friendless", and then Bill replies with "Not for long". This sets up Bill has potentially done SOMETHING in the back while Wiz and Boomstick were doing their thing (which we later see is Weirdmaggeden Equestria).  His note to "Celestia", was in fact a final message for he probably knew he isn't gonna make it out alive. The moment he rubbed Fluttershy's tapestry, that's when this Death Battle became not just some silly "what if" scenario where someone is gonna die. This became PERSONAL to Discord, to the point Discord breaks the rules of Death Battle in order to keep fighting (both combatants cannot, and must not, know about their opponent). Discord didn't care about the Death Battle anymore. He just wanted Bill to be sealed back up and Equestria safe.  Bill may have won the battle, but his victory is left empty since he ultimately failed to control Equestria, with Discord getting that satisfying last laugh. We know who got the W in the long run, and as Wiz pointed out after the battle, he WILL return.

I like the ending and the personal interpreted message. In my opinion it shows that Bill will never be happier than Discord, no matter how much more powerful he is or will be. Despite their almost identical abilities, Discord has one power that Bill doesn't have: the power of friendship. This is also consistent with what the axolotl said about him: he has no friends, he has lost his family, he has inadvertently destroyed his dimension, is probably full of sadness and remorse and bitterness and only feigns cheerfulness. Perhaps he also has to live with thoughts that his family and the inhabitants of his world hate him.  (I'm really glad that there are a lot of fanfictions in which Bill Cipher gets a chance at Redemption, grabs them and makes peace with the Pines and as unimaginable as it sounds, at the end of the story they become like a second family to him and he finally has a home for millions of years and the friends of the Pines are logically also his. Really heartwarming and therefore highly recommended.) Anyway, unlike Bill, Discord has a full life with a home and friends. That's what distinguishes the two. Bill may have won the battle, but Discord is the moral winner and contented martyr.

Beautifully done. I have just one difference of opinion, and it's a very minor one.  In the series, Discord /had/ regenerated his intangible self, after he started fading away. All it took was a little chaos. In the fight against Bill, he would have been continually getting stronger, feeding on all the weirdness Bill was slinging. If he'd wanted to re-create his body he would have. But that wouldn't have been as amusing to him.  Did Bill technically pull a win? Yes. And the ending was /perfectly/ in character. But I think that between his own powers and his friends, Discord would eventually be back. Cypher just isn't orderly enough to truly threaten his existence for long.  Still, that would be after the Death Battle itself. So, as I said, a very minor difference of opinion. And, as I said, beautifully done.

Although the research for this Death Battle episode was very well done, there is one factor that I find was overlooked too much; speed. It was quickly considered as an unimportant factor because of how the two combatants have enough control over space and time, but this is actually misleading. Although both characters have the potential for this to be true, it's not as though all of their abilities are active at all times to preemptively combat any threat. The characters would still need to activate their abilities, so whoever can do that first is an important factor, therefore their speed stats should be compared.  Bill Cipher's speed seems to be inconsistent. When angered, he wasn't able to catch Dipper and Mabel when chasing then. However, when he was describing what he could do with his abilities, he was depicted as casually flying past a gas giant planet, which means he can fly faster than light. On other occasions, he said that he could offer a galaxy, and he jumpscared Dipper at a speed faster than the eye can see. This probably means that Bill Cipher's natural speed is approximately the speed of a car, but he can greatly amplify it with his abilities. His "infinite power" and control over time should allow for his speed to potentially be what this Death Battle determined.  Discord's speed can also reach faster than light, but his speed scales above characters who can achieve this without the need to warp reality. It was even explained during this video's analysis of Discord in a black text box (at 11:07) that he might have infinite speed via scaling. "As stated by Twilight and Starswirl, their multiverse is infinite, in addition to infinite dream worlds, and realms between worlds such as Limbo. The Pony of Shadows traveling to and destroying every reality would be an infinite speed feat."  A few factors worth mentioning about Bill Cipher... 1: Bill Cipher threatening an infinite multiverse was via his non-physical abilities, so it doesn't directly count towards his speed, and definitely isn't relevant to how fast he naturally is. 2: Bill Cipher being able to see an infinite kaleidoscope of timelines has to do with his clairvoyance and strength of his mind, not his speed. 3: The Schr√∂dinger's Cat thing is probably transduality, not speed, albeit it might passively circumvent the need for speed.  Bill Cipher still has the capabilities he would need to make the fight against Discord lead to the way this Death Battle determined it would go, with Bill Cipher being able to make a physical form out of nothing, being able to harm spirits, and having significant enough reality warping to end up being able to match Discord, with the ability to obtain important knowledge on top of that. There's also still a likelihood of Discord not using his full capabilities at first anyway. Bill Cipher could end up destroying Discord's spirit, which would probably get rid of him for long enough for Bill Cipher to be considered as the winner. My observations only add that Bill Cipher would have an extra hurdle to get past at the beginning.

That was my thoughts on the music track "Discordant Decipher" and I had hoped for all of us that Death battle would create a video (great animation, in-depth and enlightening analyses, weird and Fourth wall moderate comedy, a breathtakingly insane! funny and high-octane fight with many unexpected twists) that equals this piece. Full of good weird moments and even more animation changes than Popeye Saitama. One thing worth mentioning, which is one of the reasons why this death battle is so cool, is the fact that you could clearly see that one of the "death battle" rules was followed: the moral shackle to kill is removed from one character, but all the other traits remain. Applied to this fight, that means that Discord wants to kill Bill, but not only because it's the point, but also because he's terrorizing his home, petrified the ponies of Ponyville, turned his friends and his best friend Fluttershy into flags. In the end, he may have lost, but at least he was able to make sure that his friends and his best friend. That was one of the most heroic deaths and that really gives me reason to respect Discord. So, I guess it's time to write an essay about why I disagree. Beforehand though, of course I liked the video and respect the work you did, this is just a differing opinion  (But actually I am better then you because I can win an argument about silly and completely fictional cartoons, the outcome of which is not only completely subjective but also entirely irrelevant in the end, so take that!)  First of, Discord's carefree attitude is partly a facade. Yes, he is always cracking jokes and appears to never think things through, but he always manages to manipulate a situation to the point where the main 6 not only win, but also learn a valuable lesson, like with Tirek as well as the entirety of season 9, or pretty much any episode that involves him past season 3. Even during a flashback, showing his defeat over 1000 years ago, he appeared to not take things seriously and only react once it was too late, but it was later revealed that when he recognized that the royal sisters had the means to defeat him, he set in motion a plan that would eventually free his spirit.  Furthermore, in this scenario Bill has harmed Fluttershy, which as established would lead to Discord getting very serious.. Yes, it would likely still be in his iconic attitude, but despite how it would look, he would not be messing around.  For example, Discord would be aware of the weirdness repelling properties of Unicorn hair and fully use that to his advantage, which has shown to nullify Bill's offensive capabilities. He would also be aware of the general behavior of weirdness as a fundamental force, which in the show was used to limit Bill's effectiveness.  Bill meanwhile has no physical limitations to speak of that he could use to combat Discord. The only thing proven to be effective against him were the elements of Harmony, which Bill would be unable to wield, and draining Discords Magic, which, even if he could, I would argue that it only ever happens when;  A. Discord is caught off guard because he assumes him to be a friend, or  B. When discord allows it, in order to create a situation which forces his friends to grow as characters.  (Also when Tirek absorbed Discords Magic, he was nowhere near as powerful as he ought to have been, implying that draining his magic isn't even effective in the first place)  Obviously neither of these situations would occur in this battle, meaning that Bill has access to no tool that has proven to harm Discord in any way.   What I consider the most damning piece of evidence though is the way Discord's Equestria contrasted Bill's Weirdmageddon.  See, whenever Discord was using his powers to his fullest, the world bent to his whim in every way, and the only reason the heroes stood a chance was because he let them. Bill however, while powerful, was clearly shown to have limits. He did not always know the location of his enemies the way Discord did, he did not manage to subdue the world effortlessly, having to rely on minions and allies like Gideon for example, as he was shown to not be aware that Dipper approached Mable's prison, and while he did say that it was no worries because the prison itself was secure, it clearly showed that things could develop outside of his influence even when at full power.  Lastly, more as a meta argument; The reason a character like Bill couldn't defeat Discord is that he had his own agenda that he used his powers to fulfill. In a narrative term that made him the antagonist, but more importantly, it required the protagonists to be able to overcome him.  Discord meanwhile is a character a layer removed from the actual plot. His powers never have to be challenged, because he doesn't need to be overcome. While especially true for the reformed Discord, I would argue that even antagonist Discord fits that role, because as stated previously, he seems acutely aware of how his encounters turn out, even if they seem to catch him by surprise, so his defeat at the end of the episode feels like something he had planed.

I see many people disagreeing with this so here‚Äôs my take:  I would argue Discord fighting against Bill Cipher would go against his nature. After all, think about this matchup in particular. Bill‚Äôs entire thing is that he causes chaos. Wouldn‚Äôt Discord trying to stop him and kill him go against his nature since he is actively going against a ‚Äòsource of chaos‚Äô? Discord have to forcefully be chaotic just to exist and to retain his powers while Bill Cipher has no such obligation. The only way Discord even stands a chance is that Bill Cipher and his Weirdness is inherently chaotic and thus can draw power from that.(However I would argue that Bill still benefits more since he directly draws power from the Weirdness while the only reason Discord also benefits is that the Weirdness is coincidentally chaotic in nature.)   The only canon method to beat Bill is having his existence forgotten by being erased in a mortal mind. This is a very specific win condition while replicable Bill isn‚Äôt stupid enough to allow happen again. Also the reason they state that Bill is stronger is because his 4th Wall manipulation is ‚Äòstronger‚Äô. The reason I say this is because Bill has canonically broke out of his fiction and even hijacked the mind of the author of his series, moreover it‚Äôs heavily implied he invaded our real world since there‚Äôs an entire ARG where the conclusion is a real life Bill Cipher statue that can be shaken hands with. Discord at most interacted with his book directly and made references to stuff that should only exist in our reality, beyond that we have no evidence that Discord ever canonically leave his fictional reality to enter ours the same way Bill did. Also people claiming that Discord can heal his own soul is blatantly false, he never healed from direct damage and the only time he did was when his very existence is fading away due to not being chaotic and him being chaotic stabilised him. To my knowledge, Discord never directly healed spiritual damage since we never observe his soul being directly damaged and thus healed. Thus for the sake of fairness we assume he doesn‚Äôt have the capability.   All this is especially relevant since it is highly likely both characters would know each other and their weaknesses, bypassing the ‚ÄòNo previous experience or knowledge of the opponent‚Äô rule since they would likely know each other by 4th Wall shenanigans. So Bill would likely know to go for the kill immediately and to, shockingly, cause as little chaos as possible. I think people tend to forget that Bill causes chaos for shits and giggles, unlike Discord, he isn‚Äôt actually obligated to cause chaos. So what‚Äôs really stopping him from blasting Discord‚Äôs soul to oblivion the minute conflict start and don‚Äôt cause chaos? Like laser beams and soul fire aren‚Äôt really chaotic so it‚Äôs unlikely Discord would benefit from that. Remember, Bill Cipher is an agent of chaos not the embodiment. So he can technically do anything he damn well pleases without the same strings attached the way Discord is.   Conclusion? Discord has way more clauses attached to his powers than people realise and that‚Äôs a real problem when he faces someone who has practically the same powers but without any of the requirements.

I personally feel that they seriously undermined Grogar's bewitching bell. Even if it couldn't steal Bill's powers permanently, it could still transfer a copy of his powers to Discord, who then could utilize the soul regeneration. And I think this animation didn't do well with the whole erasing memories sequence. Bill was decidedly unable to use his powers when he was trapped in an erasing mind, so there was no way he should have been able to do anything on the outside. We see that clearly when Grunkle Stan's mind was erased, he remained still and unmoving, so there was no reason that Bill should have been able to use his powers while he was being erased. Either way, they claimed that Bill could see an infinite Kaleidoscope of possibilities, Discord has the exact same ability. His omniscience is also stronger than Bill, as Bill clearly didn't hear the two Stan's switching, but Discord hears everything whether he likes it or not.

wag
Three things I find truly perplexing. When it comes to assessing weaknesses, it's crystal clear that Discord's sole Achilles' heel is his arrogance. On the other hand, Bill Cipher, despite his arrogance, harbors additional vulnerabilities. So, let's distill it down to one crucial factor: who would approach a fight with utmost seriousness, Discord or Bill?  In my estimation, Discord would undoubtedly take the battle more seriously. His motivation stems from a dire situation - the safety of Fluttershy and his other cherished friends hangs in the balance. This emotional drive alone would compel him to be deadly earnest.  Now, onto my second point: Discord is a manifestation of chaos and discord itself, an entity virtually indestructible. You can no more obliterate chaos than you can extinguish Discord. In fact, he thrives on it, drawing strength from the chaos around him. Imagine the colossal power at his disposal if Bill Cipher were in the same room ‚Äì it's your logic that suggests Bill would inadvertently bolster Discord's might.  Let's also remember that Discord's transformation from chaos to order is an internal choice. It's not imposed by external forces but a reflection of his decision to forsake chaos.   Lastly, consider this: if Discord could cunningly deceive Bill into the nightmare dimension, why not trick him into Discord Chaosville, a realm where Discord reigns supreme in utter chaos? Even if Discord couldn't outright vanquish Bill, he could entrap him in this dimension for eternity. And if things truly escalated, Discord's ability to manipulate reality could make unicorn hair the currency of doomsday.  Bringing it all together, Bill Cipher bears a plethora of weaknesses, including having to seek aid from a more potent entity for his survival. This alone demonstrates that Bill is far from being the mightiest force in the universe. In stark contrast, Discord has consistently proven himself as the apex entity in his realm. His only 'losses' occur when he intentionally dials down his omnipotence. As you've noted, Discord's power is virtually boundless; he can manifest anything he imagines. In the end, it's evident that Discord's trickery far surpasses Bill's abilities, potentially sealing Bill's fate in a prison of Discord's own design by the conclusion of their conflict.

Loved the fight but I'm going to have to disagree with the outcome. Discord should have won with little to no difficulty:  -When Bill invaded Gravity Falls, the Nightmare Realm was also leaking into it, and since there are no restrictions on what can be done within the Realm, it would explain where his power was coming from as the realm acts about the same as a dream. If you were to take him out of it, there would be no guarantee he would have any of the powers he had in Weirdmageddon, or any power at all for that matter. All Discord would need to do is remove him from the realm, and there'd be nothing Bill could do against him.  -Unlike Bill, Discord actually has feats to show he is a universal/multiversal threat, while Bill is only rumored to be. Besides his mastery of the mindscape, the 2D dimension he destroyed is his biggest feat, so you can't say he was more powerful than Discord.  -Bill needed to call upon a higher power just to survive being erased in Stan's mind, needed help getting into the 3rd/4th dimension, had his powers restricted to the inside of Gravity Falls and outside of the Shack, and needs to make a deal to enter peoples minds. Meanwhile, Discord can't truly die, has been shown to have no restrictions on what he can do, doesn't need help entering other dimensions, and can freely manipulate people's minds.  -Also, saying Discord couldn't regenerate his soul doesn't make sense if he also has the power to do whatever he wants.   -If Grogar's Bell can work on Discord, it can work on Bill. A couple of barriers meant to keep energy from the Nightmare Realm out/contained shouldn't be compared to something specifically made to drain magic from beings as powerful as Discord.  -If Discord watched his show, he wouldn't have underestimated Bill as he would have understood what he could do. When Discord had his magic drained by Tirek, it was only because he was being emotionally manipulated by him and wasn't a threat until the last minute. Bill on the other hand was clearly a threat while within Weirdmageddon, so it wouldn't make sense for Discord to be too carefree while fighting him.  In the end, Bill has no feats to show he could beat Discord much less challenge his power outside of Weirdmageddon.

Seen too few and little death battles over the years, probably because I don't really have a thing for "super vs super", I can tell this is very different than most.  When two immortal* beings face off, it is never who can kill the other. It is who has the last laugh. In other words: lose the battle, win the war.  Immortal*: some didn't include "absolutely no dying" in their shtick. If Bill could just die without invoking something, that is immortal*.

Alright I‚Äôm gonna explain some of the problems I have with the outcome of this battle .  Spoilers ahead so watch the battle first , because it is well done even if I believe it‚Äôs wrong        Alright , on the surface , discord has only been defeated by an all powerful set of magical artifacts that was never shown to lose to anything , and even then it couldn‚Äôt kill him , meanwhile bill got killed by a pair of twelve year olds and and old man .    But on to real reasons , bill being weak to unicorn hair should be HUGE in this fight .  Discord is literally from the show most accounted with unicorns .  And if your death battle you‚Äôd probably say something like ‚Äú well bill broke the barrier made by the unicorn hair‚Äù. Yeah through a fair bit of effort bill was able to break through a barrier 1 strand thick .  So that argument would be like saying since a cop can kick down a door he‚Äôs immune to all doors and can handle getting slammed with thousands of doors at once .  The other rubuttle I can think of is ‚Äúthat would be outside help ‚Äú. And not really , discord has access to an entire world of horse hair to use and can magically take it at will as he‚Äôs actually done in the show for a game of ‚Äúpin the tail on the pony ‚Äú. But even if that‚Äôs too far for you , why wouldn‚Äôt he just make some ?  Or turn himself into a unicorn if he doesn‚Äôt count already ( he is part horse and has a horn)   I also think one of the bigger nails in the coffin was seeing bill fight in the dream realm in gravity falls , where the pine twins and sous were able to overpower bill simply by being more creative than him .  If that‚Äôs all it takes then discord should have 0 difficulty doing the same but better .    Discord has also been pretty clearly shown to be a MUCH better manipulator than Bill .  If those personality weaknesses that they showed matter at all Discord would have an immense advantage   Finally and probably most importantly, they glanced over discord being able to erase memories.  That‚Äôs literally how bill died in the show , discord has the much easier win condition of trapping bill and erasing him , in his own head if he has too .  He should‚Äôve either manipulated or forced bill in , used rarities mane to trap him there , and then snap his fingers and end it .  Especially if discord has ‚Äúseen bills show ‚Äú like they stated here .  I seriously can‚Äôt believe that knowledge didn‚Äôt instantly win him the fight .  Meanwhile for bill to win he‚Äôd have to deal with discords body . Which he can make many copies of and regenerate, and then go after discords soul which still isn‚Äôt easy to hit .  Which if discord didn‚Äôt have a wincon , which they kinda imply here , that  would eventually work , but discord does have a wincon and so many opportunities to use it in the meantime I cannot fathom discord losing .    Love both shows and death battle , I even enjoyed most of this episode, I just think they got the victor very very wrong . If you disagree with anything I said I‚Äôd love to hear why .  Or if I missed one of discord‚Äôs advantages I‚Äôd love to hear that too

I've heard people say that apparently Spike was the one that likely made the deal with Bill, but I honestly thought Discord himself was the reason Bill got to Equestria.  My interpretation was that Bill somehow came in contact with Discord and, with them both being chaotic beings, convinced Discord that they could have a lot of fun together. Discord agrees and brings Bill over, whether it be by making a deal or his own power.  However, upon Weirdmageddon beginning and seeing what Bill does to Equestria and it's inhabitants, Discord quickly realized that their ideas of fun chaos are very different. Discord enjoys the playfulness and silliness of chaos, but Bill enjoys the suffering and torment it can bring.  And upon seeing what Bill did to Fluttershy, Discord decided to finally turn on him and fix his mistake.  I figured this scenario was the reason they were having a conversation at the beginning. I got the sense that Discord was probably working with Bill at first, like what he did with Tirek.  Although as I'm writing this, I've realized that the whole idea falls apart considering how Discord actually knows who Bill is already and therefore would likely never help him enter Equestria knowing full well what Bill would do.
