Ok, I got a good idea for a death battle, let me set the scene...                                  It's a peaceful day in Agrabah. Aladdin, Jasmine, Abu, Iago, and Genie having party to celebrate the defeat of Jafer. But suddenly, out the window, they see a camel with wings, Aladdin and his friends rush outside to see everything's gone topsy-turvey, they see buildings floating, humongous food crash people, it's pure chaos. Then, a weird chaotic monster, it's Discord! Aladdin and Abu try to attack Discord, but Discord just snaps is fingers turning Abu into a toy, turning into Aladdin into a piece of beard, turning Jasmine into a gold bar, and turning Iago into a pillow, Genie gets angry and puts his fits up, ready for a fight. Discord laughs, seeing Genie as a fool, but gets ready for a fight anyway. IT'S GENIE VS DISCORD!!!

I'm not sure if it count. But Bewitching Bell should work in different way then shown in the show. I assume it could be related to change im the studio during finale (aka Hasbro suck). As we may recall Grogar was "father of demons". This name actually refer to power of the bell. Bewitching bell was bewitching. It actually manipulated emotions of magical being what hear its ring. What may not be obvious from the show. But in G1 Grogar was actually a King of Unicorns! He subjugated unicorns, manipulating they magic (not in direct sense, as draining magic was skill of Tirek, who maybe did tampered with the bell? Maybe?). But Gusty the Brave overcome dark emotions of Grogar and ring the bell, restoring the balance and releasing Shadow entity he controlled. Where is where true danger of Bell is. While bell itself is only useful gadget, Grogar coincidentally attuned to his emotions powerful shadow entity capable of warping reality. It is with power of his Shadow, he was capable to turn magic being into titular demons. Most notably Sable Spirit, Daybreaker and Nightmare Moon. Ring of bell by evil being, could revert Alicorn princes into old selves. My personal guess is that show creators planes Midnight Sparkle to be final boss if the series. Where main 6 must overcome won weakens, without support of Element Transfer Spell and reach they friend.  But Hasbro suck, so we ended with mediocre finale. As they decided to move studio during production, firing critical staff.

He may have lost the fight but he won the war and since he is chaos he will eventually reform
Y'know, aside from the win-in-spirit that Discord got, he came pretty close to ACTUALLY winning the fight too. Going into Bill's mind, lighting his dreamscape on fire and distracting him with a close-up battle long enough for it to burn probably would have worked if the Stans' plan also worked. If only Discord were lethal enough and good enough at fighting to actually hold his own once he was in Bill's domain, even for just a little longer. It doesn't take long for Bill to die when trapped inside a mind that's falling apart, and the battle showing his form glitching seems to suggest he was taking heavy damage.  So aside from just being a death battle where the loser sort of won in their own way, this battle also acknowledges a good way Discord really COULD have won the fight. You don't get that often out of Death Battle, usually the loser's final attack or last ditch effort ends up being something the winner has an easy answer to which is why it doesn't work. But this? Bill's only way to defend against Discord going in his head and lighting it on fire was to get rid of him, and fast. Granted Bill can definitely do that, especially when the fight is taken to his own head, but still it's a better last ditch effort than most combatants get.  I just think it's cool to see the loser of a death battle having a plan that actually would have worked if not for the other guy just... winning the fight before it could. This episode gave mad respect to Discord, hope we see more of that kind of respect to losers in the future.
Do not agree with the result, but it was fun and Discord was even a hero to his friends.

While I did like the ending being respectful (Even though, yeah, I was pulling for Bill), it's been a bit tiring that the only thing said is "Bill won the fight but Discord won the war". No, Bill isn't trapped forever, and considering how stupid people are, he can easily be out in no time. Also, the verdict gives Discord quite a bit of benefit of doubts, because no, Discord has never shown to come back from spiritual erasure in any media (Bill actually has in the GF Complete Series collection) and the line it's based off is just "You can't kill malice!" by a character losing their cool after being bested. Also, Discord is not literally a concept, he's been separated from his chaos magic before, which should be impossible if he's the actual concept of all chaos. As well, him fading away was because he was doing something antithetical to his nature, and was simply restored due to himself acting chaotic again. It's like if a human stopped breathing, which is antithetical to our nature, but we started breathing again. It is not actually proof of conceptual immortality, if anything, it's a weakness of Discord's.

This episode's outcome is so unique, that I have an alternate closing of the episode that would play more like this.  Boomstick: GOD DAMN‚Äº I don't know what got my attention more at the end: Discord's "loss" or Bill Cipher's "win." That triangle seriously has a location memory problem, huh?  Wiz: Out of all the death battles we've seen, this one arguably has the most complicated outcome in the show.   Boomstick: Bill killed Discord, but what does that matter to him if his precious weirdmageddon has been undone in the process? As for Discord, sure there's no denying that he is carefree at times, but when it comes to Fluttershy, he takes his friendship with her seriously, otherwise he wouldn't accidentally try to kill himself when he was house-hosting her accordingly.  Wiz: Meaning that from the moment he started fighting Bill, his priority was saving Fluttershy and Equestria, and when he succeeded, he accepted his fate.  Boomstick: While giving Bill a metaphorical middle finger for not getting the gravity of his plans falling into place.   Wiz: Although being the personification of chaos he is, as long as the mane 6 (especially Fluttershy, Twilight, and Pinkie) gets a bit chaotic while attempting to summon him back to life, he can't really die. So, the only reason Discord is considered dead in the episode is that he needed help from other characters to be spiritually healed.  Boomstick: And even then, Discord wouldn't have a reason to fight Bill once he's brought back to life, as Bill wouldn't have a reason to fight Discord as he is more interested in escaping the nightmare realm, and recreating the oddpocalypse.   Wiz: Discord may have lost the Death Battle, but his fourth wall-breaking knowledge, chaotic cunning, and yes. His "friendship is magic" value for the shy little pony, means that he ultimately won the weirdest war Equestria, and this show has ever been through.  Boomstick: And the poor old one-dollar Bill Cipher is trapped in a discordant nightmare where his name is now "The Great Pyramid of Pyrrhus."  Bill Cipher: *LET ME OUT OR I'LL EAT YOUR DREAMS!!*  (Wiz and Boomstick jump back as Bill says this)  Wiz: Sorry, Bill, but the winner is Discord. One drains you of your energy The other takes away your power and gives it to someone else. It's like draining the battery on your phone versus taking away the phone. Before the fight, I thought Bill was probably smarter and more creative due to his restrictions forcing him, while discord pretty much never had to try. My expectation was that Discord would win because he could probably reproduce the erase mind trick on Bill (which wouldn't actually kill him) and also that he had free dimensional mobility since he could open portals, and Bill could be banished. But if either could win via actual kill, it would be based on some specific detail.  In the end, such never mattered, because the fight was unbelievably awesome, the characterization spot on with no need for an excuse to fight, and it was a mutual loss in the end. Whether discord legitimately died or will recover because chaos exists, Bill was banished, which is the closest to a kill you can get on him.

I‚Äôm not too bothered by the result, but I feel that they didn‚Äôt quite understand Discord‚Äôs spirit powers, unless there‚Äôs something more clear about it in the comics.   They repeatedly say that if Discord‚Äôs physical form is gone he can return as a spirit, but this actually hasn‚Äôt been shown in the show, as he has never completed lost his physical form.   The scene they kept showing of him being blasted and what looks like ‚Äúdisintegrating‚Äù, then coming back as a ghost is pretty out of context- it wasn‚Äôt his form being destroyed, rather a spell which sent him away and banished from the location. This simply prevented his physical body from entering the grounds, kind of like how unicorn hair prevented Bill from touching the shack. However, in Discord‚Äôs case, he easily bypassed this magic by entering in a spirit form.   The only way we‚Äôve been shown his spirit could fully disappear is the ‚Äònormal pills‚Äô moment. Discord has only ever taken damage/been hurt when he‚Äôs without his magic.  Like I can justify that yeah Bill getting a hold of him as a spirit and killing him the way he did could work, but the fact that Discord so easily lost his physical form from a chess piece falling on him was kinda.. ?   He has purposely let himself get blasted in the face with powerful dark magic just so he could pretend to be dying to motivate everyone else to fight and stop relying on his OP powers üò≠ I was really surprised that THAT is how little it took to force him to become a spirit.   gg still I guess

Working under the assumption that Bill was attempting to win, it is reasonable to assume that he expected me to play for the same goal. I was playing only for a standoff, a draw. While Bill was dedicated to winning, I was able to pass up obvious avenues of advancement and settle for a balance. In the strictest sense, I did not win. I busted him up." -Discord    Nothing in my mind encapsulates the conclusion of this battle better than altering the quote of Data from Next generation.

I love how the fight script played out in ways that give homage to both source material's inspirations. Bill is a true-to-form Lovecraftian Entity, you can't actually kill him, only seal him away at great sacrifice. Likewise, Discord is much like the old classic trickster gods, someone who can mess with higher beings and make clever plans, but is ultimately not all that strong and more out to cause mischief than take over things, making them more like a mid-boss for heroes and victims for villains alike.
Bill's personal win condition was to kill Discord and conquer Equestria. Discord's win condition was to protect his friends.  Discord might've lost the death battle, but he won by his own rules.

Oh my god, they're FINALLY doing Mercer vs. Cole.  Can't wait!
While I agree with most DB results, I firmly have to disagree with this one, and I'm saying this as someone who likes Bill a LOT more than Discord. First, Discord is the more powerful one. He's manipulated reality far more freely, extensively, and easily than Bill. Plus, he doesn't face such limitations on his powers like Bill does, for instance, Bill has had his power confined and/or neutralized a lot more, he can't freely move through dimensions or open portals or send others through them unless certain conditions are met, he needs to make deals before he can do certain things, etc. Also, while he can regenerate, Bill can be harmed by simple things, like Mable's hairspray to his eye or having his eye ripped out, while Discord can't really be harmed unless he allows it (like he can get shot, but he won't be "hurt" unless he wants to be). On that note, Discord never had his body destroyed, he was simply magically banished from school grounds, so he re-entered them as a ghost since only his physical form was banished as a loophole. Plus, Discord is an immortal god of chaos who thrives and is empowered by chaos, so anything Bill does to him would only make him stronger. Contrary to that, Bill needs to get rid of opposition of someone with a similar power in order to have full dominion over it, as evident by him saying he only had power over time once he got rid of Time Baby. Unless his power is drained, the only thing that can harm Discord is a lack of chaos, which causes him to fade away. In any case, he could have easily gotten rid of Bill by creating a copy of himself and having Bill enter its mind, then just erasing his copy, or defeated him a number of other ways. Discord should have won this.

On March 26th 2022,  just past midnight,  I was laying restless in bed,  and I had a heart attack.  My arms became tingly and numb,  then my chest got tighter,  and then my heart felt like it was being crushed.  So I sang out to God and Jesus,  about my pain, my feelings,  my faults and my inabilities.  As I sang, I began to feel like a river,  and His hand's fingers where skimming the surface,  separating the waters,  causing ripples through my body.  Then His hand reached inside,  and lit my heart on fire,  the heat moved like waves through my body.  When I was done singing,  all the pain was gone,  and I looked at the clock,  it was past 1am,  I had been singing near an hour.  Then the voice of my guardian angel called my name from above,  and there was a hymn of energy in the air, the same hymn I hear in my dreams of God.  Hallelujah for the Lord my God!  Hallelujah for His son Jesus!  Hallelujah for every day!  Hallelujah for every breath!

17:57 "we know fully erasing Discord will kill him" Just because Discord choosing to not be chaotic would kill him,  doesn't mean he can't regenerate his soul. Who healed Dipper's soul after Bill shot a hole through it?
For those debating how Bill won despite Discord having an insane healing factor:  Death Battle only considers 'Death' if the following citeria was met:  1. If one opponent has more methods to kill them than the other (i.e. Pokemon Royal Rumble) 2. If one opponent is vastly superior in feats than the others. 3. In cases of stalemate (i.e. this Death Battle), whoever can return the fastest from nothing wins.  Bill is more than capable of returning instantly even when erased from existence, while Discord takes time before coming back to fight again.   By technicality, Bill won tactically speaking, but as shown in this Death Battle, Discord beats him strategically.

I'm not going to lie, I was both excited and anxious for this episode. The core theme of both combatants is unpredictable chaos, meaning that ANYTHING could happen. I was wondering how Death Battle was going to pull off the chaos in a way that truly made it feel like you had NO IDEA what the combatants were going to throw at each other (and at us) all the while making it enjoyable and gloriously manic. And the crazy talented people at Death Battle have truly outdone themselves. This episode exceeded my wildest expectations, and I have to say that the voice actors for Bill Cipher and Discord gave wonderfully enjoyable performances. From start to finish, I was laughing and crying SO HARD! ü§£üòÜü§£üòÜü§£  And the ending is fittingly insane; Bill Cipher and Discord both won the battle in different ways. In the battle of goals, Discord won by tricking Bill into taking Weirdmageddon away from Canterlot and bringing everything back to normal (at the cost of his own life). In the battle to the death, Bill won by annihilating Discord (at the cost of being imprisoned in the Nightmare Realm). With warped credits, spontaneous animation shifts, the bullet-point fact lists hijacked by omniscient bickering, the camera being distorted (and even Wiz and Boomstick being turned into their voice actors!), who knows if the fourth wall will remain intact in the next episode after being THOROUGHLY and UTTERLY SHATTERED in this one!

The only reason Discord was disappearing was because he was actively eliminating chaos, which is HIM.  All it took to restore him entirely was Fluttershy basically making a mess of things. Since Bill is also all about creating chaos, this should make him impossible to eliminate, because he is the embodiment of chaos itself.  So Discord should be just as immortal, and with growing chaos his magic grows too. Also it is established that Discord doesn't mess around when it comes to saving Fluttershy. There is also no evidence he CAN be killed enough to become a ghost, that was heavily implied to be him messing around again. He does that often.  So if they're both basically immortal and all powerful, would it be a draw? I would say no, as Discord has one power that Bill does not.  Discord can freely travel all realities whenever he wants. Bill, cannot.  So regardless of how this momentary battle panned out, I would say Discord actually won, and as he's an immutable aspect of reality, he'll just return to life from chaos. BILL CIPHER + More powerful when weakened having annihilated cosmic beings and probability precognition + Can regenerate from all physical & some spiritual damage + More bloodthirsty especially against cosmic beings like Time Baby = Has equivalents or counters to most abilities - Complete spiritual erasure could kill him - Arrogance can get the best of him DISCORD + Physical regeneration makes him hard to kill + Far more creative with his abilities = Has equivalents or counters to most abilities - Less powerful when weakened - Lacks regeneration feats including soul regeneration beyond physical damage  - Could not debilitate Bill by draining his powers

I disagree with the winner in this battle. Discord, like Cosmos, is a being that is an embodiment of a concept. Cosmos implied that even if she was depowered she would not be able to die due to her existence being linked with said concept. This means that even if Discord had his powers stolen or sealed away, he can't be killed due to his existence being linked to the concept of chaos. The only way to get rid of Discord is for the concept of Chaos itself to be erased, which is completely opposite of Bill's motive. Bill cannot erase Chaos as it is a necessary concept for Weirdmageddon, and as such cannot kill Discord.

I feel the dimensional scales were way off... bill cipher can barely destroy an universe, you used his statements as feats, while in truth he wasn't able to break free totally due the the weirdness field... he needed help and contracts to even go to another dimension!  discord on the other hand has way more multiversal feats, just by keeping up with the rest of the big hitters in the setting, so basically nothing bill can do would be able to hurt discord!  it's also hard to say bill cipher is truly incapable of dying or being erased, because he never faces a superior challenge in the show, in a degree of infinite above himself...  at the end of the day it's a being that couldn't go pass a natural occurring weirdness field, and was said to just be able to destroy an universe over time, and be a threat to the multiverse because with help he can travel to others and wreck the place... to a being that has shown no upper limits for his powers, and was capable of keeping up with other multiversal (and that is an infinite number of infinite time space continuums ) threats a lot of times before! I found three secret messages, one of which was in the description.  A HDU'B VJXU DMZL KYWVRWR LPVXG Key: SEPHIROTH Message: I DON'T EVEN LIKE CHICKEN WINGS  VOVEVM WVVA MFGA SZS Key: Atbash Cipher Message: ELEVEN DEEZ NUTS HAH  Jpavhoj Fskypld DLPYKSF JOHVAPJ Key: ??? Message: WEIRDLY CHAOTIC  I don't know the message or the key for the last two messages, but this seems to tell us that a future Death Battle will feature Sephiroth. I tried using the likely matchups, Vergil and the Mario Bros, but to no avail. What do you think?  EDIT: I figured out the rest, thanks to the Death Battle Wiki! So, the first cipher isn't actually a prediction. It's a reference to the Sephiroth vs Bill Cipher episode of Crossover Coliseum. The second message is decoded with the atbash cipher, and references how Bill Cipher was given a power ranking of 11D. I had trouble decoding the third message, because it's actually in _reverse!_ It too is decoded with a vignere cipher, but the wiki doesn't actually tell me what the key is. Let's find out together, shall we? ... It's H. The key is H. Well, I guess that's my fault for looking too deeply into things.

0:35 Bill Cipher 6:56 Discord  13:26 Death Battle I loved this death battle, but there are some things i have to announce since there was a lot of misconception in this one, and give some pointers. 17:30 Yes the unicorn hair was not able to drain the power of bill, but the bell is able to drain the power of any magical or power source being, like discord himself, chaos and all, making the bell far above any magical hair or spell in Gravity falls, since the magic hair of a unicorn could stop bill's attacks against them, the bell is well over the unicorn hair, being able to drain the power of things above unicorn magic.  17:56 in order too erase or even kill discord, would be to destroy chaos itself, or stop discord from being chaotic, since in the scene discord being erased, he was only fading out of existence because he was trying to not be so chaotic for *fluttershy*, and because of that he was basically killing himself. But he exists in the hearts of those who hold chaos, so he would just reappear from Bill's heart, due to bill being very chaotic, and since bill can die without disrupting the existence of chaos, that would mean bill would of been easier too kill then discord.  So in conclusion, discord would have won, and could have redone bill's death, just like how he died at the end of gravity falls, as said in the video 18:11 "Discord had all the tools to replicate something like that". Plus Bill was able to be held back (Attack wise) against unicorn hair that came from unicorns who couldn't even use magic, there for even a unicorn without magic can block his attacks, and though discord could be weakened by unicorns, it is only at times they are wielding a magical ancient artifact. and the only two the were able to affect discord were two of the strongest in existence, and even then it didn't last forever.  And said in 18:46 yes he is more care free well it comes to his past opponents, but that was mostly due to the fact he was betrayed by the ones he cared and trusted (like how he trusted tirek but was caught off guard because he trusted him).  Over all discord would have won this death battle (No hate for the death battle team)

Fight animation keeps getting better and better-think this match up was just an excuse to show off animation styles/quality. Was a brain-breakingly difficult match to keep up with, and I initially thought the result was the opposite of what was claimed (IE assumed the loser had won and the winner had lost). I suppose the moral victory goes to the fallen. It was less a matter of 'who has the greatest feat'-both combatants being toon-style reality warpers render this point moot-but more a case of 'which one has a specific fine-print loophole that can be exploited?' Little surprised that unicorn hair (Which Discord would have knowledge of from 'watching your show' and ready access to) did not play more of a role. Still, very well done, fight animation and acting the best since Popeye vs Saitama, and kudos for ANYONE trying to puzzle out who'd come out on top between these two piles of overpowered, logic-free cartoon nonsense. Has one of the most emotionally impactful endings as well-impressive for a series based around settling nerd debates by bashing action figures together.

Discord: I‚Äôm sorry but I lost, but at least I banished Bill Cipher from Equestria
It would have made more sense that he has unicorn hair protecting him, even if he wasn't aware of it. Real life hair sticks to clothing or skin thanks to static cling, and with just how much hair is in Equestria it's not even a question that some would find its way onto Discord. Bill couldn't technically break the barrier formed from unicorn hair either in the original Gravity Falls show, he could only effect whatever stuck out of the force-field. Especially since it would be his friend (of a friend's) hair and how that kind of thing works in Equestria Bill would likely not even be able to touch Discord at all. Moreover if you consider some of that hair would have come from one or all four potential alicorns, which are literally just ritualistically empowered unicorns that are by every margin stronger than plain unicorns, it would be even more effective. Also if Discord "watched his show" and knew Bill's weakness he would definitely procure some hair as a backup plan, he literally planted a seed that would have freed him from his magical prison on its' own if he wasn't awoken by bickering children on accident, so he's no stranger to contingency plans. Furthermore, if conflict and strife make him stronger, the longer Bill and Discord's confrontation takes the more likely it is that Discord would win. If one pays attention to both shows and how they actually function I don't think it would be very certain to declare Bill the victor.

Easily in my top 3 battles from you guys. But one thing I really loved was the ending to this fight, as it was structurally perfect. Let me explain.  What I loved about this battle is how they specifically mentioned discord beat his partner Cosmo, who was essentially his equal. Implying discord has experienced fighting characters at his power level.  However he didn't kill his partner. He just sealed him in the stars. Implying 1 of 2 things.  1. He showed his partner mercy or.. 2. He could not kill someone with equal power and instead had to resort to sealing them away..  With this in mind the ending of the battle makes perfect sense. Discord tried to erase Bill's mind from the inside, but when he realized he couldn't win, he instead chose to free his friends and seal bill away in the nightmare realm.  Its little things like that from the analysis that are taken notice that turn good battles, into great battles.  Well done guys! I only wish this was the season finale because I don't know how you guys will top this one.

I would like to point out the one major flaw in the analysis; the idea that Discord would not take this fight seriously.  In a standard DB scenario (these two, in a void, no outside help) then yeah, Discord would probably just be having fun. But the scenario used was Bill threatening Ponyville... and by extension, Fluttershy.  It is *consistent* that the *second* Flutters is confirmed in danger or worse, Discord drops all pretenses and goes for the kill. No screwing around, no long winded conversations, if he believes Flutters to be in danger she and her friends can't fix, *he fixes it.*   So yeah. I can accept the result... But not that part of the analysis.

I strongly disagree with this outcome... for a number of reasons. Firstly, Bill's limits. He can't enter physical space to begin with unless he has a host, and in the mindscape he's naturally bound to, others' minds can be used to counteract his own abilities. Even with a host, Bill takes on their weaknesses. Secondly, still on the point of limits, Bill's power is actually severely lacking, which is observable in one major point... Bill was never able to breach the boundary that contains weirdness to Gravity Falls. He required Ford's help to do that, and never got it. On his own, he lacks the power to break beyond any boundaries, whether that's the boundary from the nightmare dimension into the physical reality, or from Gravity Falls into the real world. Thirdly, Bill heavily relies on his environment. The vast majority of the chaos he creates makes use of the people and items around him, such as bringing the water towers to life and altering other creatures. If deprived of those opportunities, he'd lack a lot of his arsenal. Fourthly, Bill has been easily damaged in the past by means that Discord could easily match, such as Bill's eye being torn out by the Mystery Mech. He's far from invulnerable, and if not for several missed opportunities, he'd have never gotten to be as big a threat as he was to begin with. Fifthly, his reliance on outside help and underlings. Bill will seldom do his own dirty work, and prefers to leave his opponents to his monsters and allies, which brings me onto the sixth point... Sixthly, intelligence... or lack thereof. Bill's an absolute moron. He didn't account for others using their minds in the mindscape, didn't account for Mabel being freed from Mabelland, didn't account for the Stan switcheroo... his arrogance leads him to make terrible mistakes and leave himself incredibly vulnerable. Seventhly... willingness, more the fact that many of his greatest abilities and powers require a willing second party to give him what he needs. Gideon and DIpper making deals with him, Mabel handing over the dimensional rift, Stanford helping him breach the weirdness containment... without a willing second party, he's severely limited. Overall, a being like Discord, whose reach goes beyond even his own reality with his fourth-wall awareness and who is capable of draining power from other beings, and who as a trickster would be wise to Bill's trickery, would very easily overpower the arrogant, limited pyramid with, honestly, very little effort... Bill was only a threat because idiots let him be, and even then he only ever got to be a threat to those idiots. Any suggestion of power beyond that level is purely speculatory. You can disagree if you want, but this is my stance. There is far, far too much working against Bill for him to win this.

So Bill won the battle, but Discord won the war.  Makes sense.  Really the only limiting factor in this fight is the characters imaginations, and I feel Discord has the upper hand in that category.  He constantly references things that are beyond his own universe, like Bob Ross.  Meanwhile Bill's knowledge seems to be contained within his own universe.  I think that gives Discord larger imagination in terms of what they can accomplish with their magic, since their only limits are what they can imagine. So the ending to this fits.  Neither one can "magically" defeat or overpower the other.  The only way to win is to out think the other.    The other note to consider, is that Discord will always exist as long as chaos exists.  He is more of a concept.  So there are only 2 ways to kill him for good.  Get him to stop being chaotic, or create a universe with no chaos.  Bill is a pretty chaotic guy, so as long as Bill is doing weird stuff, Discord cant be killed.  However Bill has no such boon.  He is a creature of chaos, but chaos itself.  Thus he can be killed.

My only complaint is a conceptual one that has no perfect basis within either show; In MLP, it's pretty much stated outright (and it's even mentioned here) that Discord is powered by disharmony. As such, even being around the reality-warping shenanigans Bill creates should make Discord more powerful. By contrast, Bill Cypher has no clear power source. While Bill's power is infinite, mathematic formulas have shown for a while that there are different sizes between infinities. Essentially, if infinite set A is contained within infinite set B, then infinite set B must be larger. As such, it would stand to reason that Discord is actually more powerful than Bill Cypher, at least while they're fighting. Bill's power is a static infinite-so far as we've been shown-while Discord's is stated to have a source. In essence, every act of power exerted by Bill would only serve to make Discord more powerful, as it would only further increase the amount of 'disharmony' present in whatever realm they're fighting in.
Now I see why Bill Cipher is a fan favorite!

Apocalypse vs doomsday
I will still argue Discord should win simply based off two things he can do that Bill is statedly unable to. He can hope universes at will, and control minds. Bill can torture you into doing what he wants, but he can't MAKE you do what he wants, or want to do it yourself. Discord can flip your personality around at will, literally snapping his fingers to cause it, and can hope universe as will, generating his own portals.  Oh, and he can read thoughts. Technically Bill can kind of do that by entering a willing or sleeping mind, but he can't do it directly like Discord can(This might be medium awareness, however, as he was reading thought balloons). Don't worry folks the mlp card game confirmed that Discord has a backup Discord back home.  The fight was honestly probably the best fight in the series, definitely the best of the season.   I do have some problems with the logic for the winner though. I think using Bill being able to hurt dream people and heal himself in the dream world is a bit of a stretch. Also I would argue the weirdness shield is more about negating rather than absorbing which are different. Not to mention we only see it absorbing a possessed Tiki statue and not anything as strong as Discord, so comparing it to Grogar's bell is a bit of a stretch.  I can see why they see it that way though even if I don't agree.  The only thing I just straight up don't like about the research of the fight was that they used a reddit AMA to explain Bill knowing pretty much everything which I'm pretty sure is non-cannon and is straight up contradicted in the show.   Also as mentioned above Discord has essentially a 1-up with the back up and the series shows there is no limit to the copies Discord can pretty much make infinite one ups. Discord has been shown to possess multiple bodies and each Discord copy has his powers and memories. Ok, so even with this its a tie since the fight would go on forever, but Death Battle's animation did bring a way Discord could win. All he has to do is trick Bill in there and leave him. Bill can't leave the Nightmare realm by himself, but Discord can. All Discord has to do is leave, close the portal, and boom he wins. It's a nontraditional win in Death Battle, but Bill would no longer be able to fight for a good amount of years which I would consider a win. I'm sure people will disagree with me, but that's ok. I was just explaining my position. Also Discord could just chill in his dimension and send his copies to fight Bill. Bill wouldn't be able to go to his dimension, so Discord had a way to fight Bill without endangering himself at all. Still love the battle  While I disagree with the outcome I can't be too mad, because as many pointed out Bill might have won the battle, Discord won the war since he saved his friend, Equestria, and will come back eventually. Bill is right back where he started and it will take several years to find another world to conquer.  Anyways my headcanon is that the back up Discord back home appeared to Fluttershy after the portal closed.

Wait. Discord's powers grow, as there is more chaos around him ? Bill Cipher's powers grow, as Weirdmageddon continues ? First of all, what were the odds that those two characters would fight specifically during Weirdmageddon and not at literally any other time ? Second of all, Wouldn't this whole battle make Discord completely unstoppable ? Bill Cipher only gains more power from spending time in Weirdmageddon, but Discord gains more power by being chaotic on his own and by being around the chaos caused by Weirdmageddon. So, each time Bill Cipher's power grows, Discord's power grows even more. Also, if they were to fight outside of Weirdmageddon, only Discord would grow in power. In any case, (Weirdmageddon or not), Bill Cipher's growth in power would either be completely nonexistent or completely insignificant, compared to Discord's growth in power. I saw Gravity Falls a long time ago and I never watched My Little Pony, so I may be missing a lot, but this whole gradient of power thing still seems intriguing enough to wonder who really should have won.

I may not know how much about how the infamous Powers work, but I do know how the Prototype Powers work.  So if you need this, you're free to use it; here's my formula of how it works. You can even research it yourself and add on to it, or just start your own. Although the progression system (for the redlight creatures) is my head cannon, so you can do with that part as you like, implemented, ignore it, Etc.  Here's some things that may help you, in this story and others dealing with the Blacklight and Redlight virus.  Through the fact that the virus can manipulate chemicals, minerals, etc (non-living things) as well as it can living things (albeit just a bit slower) this literally means that those with the blacklight virus can use anything as a source of biomass (just have to break it apart to its basic materials), including but not limited to trees, iron, rock, water, a f****** mountain, etc (basically if the virus can come into physical contact with it, it can consume it).  Also those with the blacklight virus can mess with there DNA and the DNA of others (as long as they have physical contact with them) to a nearly infinit degree (only limited by the available resources). Of course it's better to start out young, because the younger the host/subject the less of a foundation they have. Meaning that there DNA could be altered to make them get the best that they could get from there DNA, and it wouldn't be as hard as it would be with an adult. Via the fact that there body would experience a drastic change (which comes with its own problems), instead of growing into it.  Ohh. And here's the formula on how to know the difference between the Redlight and Blacklight virus:  Redlight makes the infected creatures (brawlers, hunters, etc.) specifically. While Blacklight makes only evolved/runners like Alex Mercer, James Heller, etc.  Also after Alex consumed Elizabeth his virus (Blacklight) gain the ability to produce, and control the Redlight virus (located mainly in the blood, unless host decides to produce it somewhere else. And that is if they decide to still have there body produce it, because like an on/off switch they can turn it off/on. The control part is through the hivemind ability he also gain from Elizabeth Greene).  Here's the evolution of Redlight infected.  There are a few different levels of Redlight infected:  'infected' (normal citizens with the Redlight virus),  'Combat infected' (soldier's, or infected that have evolve to the next stage),  (P.s. All Redlight infected evolve to the next levels by consuming enough biomass, although they can't get it from just any source. It has to be a living source, aka, they eat enough meat, they evolve.  There is another way they can evolve though, which is by grouping togather and becoming one. Depending on the level this can go from needing multiple infected of the same level, to just 2.)  'Vultures' (one of two evolution options that 'Combat infected' can take, they're basically flying infected that look like big infected crows),  'Brawlers' (the other evolution option for 'Combat infected', they're basically tanky soldier's used for both the front lines of battle and patrols to make sure that enemies aren't in your territory, also they hunt in packs),  'Hunters' (evolved from the 'Brawlers' these guys got evey thing they have, but double be it strength, speed, intelligence, etc, so most of the time if there's a group of 'Brawlers' there's a chance that there's a 'Hunter' or 'Hunters' leading them),  'Juggernauts' (evolved from the 'Hunters' these guys are basically the heavy units giving up speed and mobility for strength and defense),  'Hydras' (evolved from the 'Juggernauts' these guys are mostly concealed underground where their body is, the part sticking out is there heads. These guys are basically living artillery, being able to throw things with great force),  'Behemoths' (evolved from the 'Hydras' these guys are the trump cards, they're the last resort (or the answer to when you want a bunch of enemies killed, and there is enough room for them to fit through unless they simply smash through any obstacles infront of it), and their the last stage a Redlight virus creature can reach),  'Alphas' (also known as the special unit these guys are twice as powerful as they would normally be (equally roughly their next stage of evolution), meaning if there is a 'Alpha Brawler' he'll have the power of a 'Hunter', 'Alpha Hunter' the power of a 'Juggernaut' so on and so forth).  Be warned none of these guys like to go alone so they like to be in groups unless it's the 'Behemoths', because they're too big making it hard for them to move in groups.  P.s. Be warned the virus (redlight, then blacklight after Alex consumed Elizabeth) has a conscious, which is why Elizabeth Greene wasn't turned into an infected creature and why she had a mother complex. Then Alex with his whole going evil (which is more like he hit puberty a second time) thing, and James will probably follow.

Neat, but I think the reasoning is weak. I don't know much about Gravity Falls, but Bill seemed to me like a very powerful traveler, in much the same vein as Rick Sanchez (if Rick was genocidal and empowered himself rather than rely on "cheap" tricks to make the odds of his death more even), whereas Discord is a deity, and despite when deities are created, they are and always have been in existence regardless of death. Bill reached his demise after following a prophecy, and there's no reason why Discord couldn't have either reset the entire Gravity Falls franchise so that Bill would eventually repeat his past mistakes while Discord watches with the audience in a separate dimension, or if Bill ever figured it out, he could be distracted by a super-secret prophecy. Bill was born in the 2nd Dimension and became the multi-dimensional monster that he is, but he lacks omniscience and he needs direction like prophecies to guide his chaos; Discord is a deity who is both omnipotent and omniscient - he should be capable of giving Bill everything he wants, and in some version he probably does just to see what "Weirdmageddon" is all about, and if it affects his relationship with Fluttershy, Discord can change the genre of "Weirdmageddon" to fit his narrative, like change it to an endless dating sim where Bill must woo one of the Equestrian ponies with his wingman, Discord-sempai.  It stands to reason that Bill followed a prophecy for "Weirdmageddon" to occur, yet Discord already is Weirdmageddon incarnate.

Day nine of asking for JCVD vs Steven seagal
The ending to this fight was kind of genius. Since these two combatants are forced to fight until a conclusive death per the format of the show, Bill wins on that front. But the goals and motivations of these two characters exists outside of that format; Bill wanting to conquer the MLP universe and Discord wanting the safety of Fluttershy (and her friends, I guess).   At the higher meta level, Discord beat Bill. It's an excellent sequel to the similarly meta previous death battle, where Silver Surfer and Martian Manhunter questioned why they had to fight to the death despite it being against their nature.

I don't agree with the result, a lot of the things given were wrong.  Bill being able to see that infinite calendoscope just means that he can see SOME versions of himself there while knowing that in total there are infinite, not that he can see all infinite of them at once and therefore has infinite speed. It's so stupid. That was even 2D Bill, meaning that he never showed being that fast in the show, for what that's worth.  Bill was stated to be a threat to the multiverse by Ford twice before he knew he could cause cosmic destruction, so in context he meant his ability to invade dreams and possess others across the multiverse made him a threat, not that he could destroy it. The threat in the show was that he could destroy the universe only (As said many times in the show), and even Blendin (the time travelling guy) went to the future to see the universe having been destroyed by that (Journal 3), meaning that time wasn't destroyed, let alone was the multiverse mentioned.  The rip that was going to destroy the universe was part of Bill's powers, yes, but he grew it over time, there is no reason to say his every attack is as powerful as the end result of it, in fact it's stupid, because 1. it again takes time for that thing to grow, 2. if Bill could make the rip as big as he could he would have done so as that makes his powers grow, and 3. not all his powers are the same, it's stated to be magic by Ford and some powers have limits like needing to make deals. That's like seeing someone creating an attack that builds up power for a week and then it destroys the world, then claim that their every move is as powerful as destroying the world, because they were the ones charging that attack w/ their power you see.  I don't know Discord as well as Bill, but the way you guys saw everything both can do and concluded that they had to be the same (Speed: Doesn't matter, Strength: Universal, possibly Multiversal) comes off as naive and as inexperience to me. Aside from that, it was an ok ep, I respect the rest of the work around.

While I enjoyed the battle, I don't agree with the conclusion. Simply put, I don't believe Bill has the capacity to kill discord.   Discords spirit has only been shown being jeopardized by one thing, being a lack of chaos. With bills very nature being chaos, it would only further empower Discord. As an entity, discords power grows exponentially with the chaos around him. Bills very presence could very well make discord invincible.  Conversely, bill was defeated by mortal inventions, something discord never was.  Shortly put, Discord without a doubt has the capacity to kill bill, but Bill doesn't have the ability to do the same.

19:21
To answer everybody's question on whether or not Discord is dead or not, it says it in the episode. "As the spirit of chaos, Discord may one day reform, as Cosmos implied he cannot be destroyed forever due to embodying malice. However, their return would take time, and there is no proof Discord can return from spiritual destruction fast enough to resume the fight." This means that even with his spirit being destroyed, he can still come back. However, it's unclear how long it might take.

Anyone else know which cipher to use to translate that gobbldeygook? EDIT 9/27/23 OK I AM DUMB. The first one (A hdu‚Äôb vjxu dmzl kywvrwr lpvxg) is translated through a Vign√®re cipher as "I DON'T EVEN LIKE CHICKEN WINGS" if you use the keycode SEPHIROTH. Crossover Colosseum did an episode where Bill fought Sephiroth, and he called him "Chicken Wing" because of... the one wing. The other is "vovevm wvva mfgh szs", which run through an Atbash cipher reads "ELEVEN DEEZ NUTS HAH" For the music track, the title in the credits "jpavhojfskypld" but put it backwards through a Caesar cipher and it reads "WEIRDLYCHAOTIC" There is a point in the song where it says, backwards, "Why are you listening to this part backwards? Don't tell me you're some kind of tinfoiler. You do know the song doesn't decide who wins, right?" And the final backwards message at the end of the episode: "REALITY IS AN ILLUSION, THE UNIVERSE IS A HOLOGRAM, BUY GOLD, BYEEEEE!" Just finished the series today for the first time in my life, btw. People have already touched on the ending a bit, but after reading a few comments I wanna expand on it a bit more. Spoilers, obviously.    Discord wasn't going to win this fight, and I have a strong feeling he knew that. Hence why he knew the *only* way he was going to defeat Bill Cipher and save Equastria was going to be tricking Bill with something he couldn't think about. Self-sacrifice. It's basically how Bill Cipher was defeated in Gravity Falls as well. Discord did exactly what he was planning to do, even when he said "Well, it was worth a try," he was just stalling for time so Bill couldn't get to the portal at the end before it closed. Discord couldn't kill Bill, but he could still save his friends, even if it cost him everything.

You know what? This is exactly what I needed today. My dad passed away last night due to liver failure, and we had to say our goodbyes to him. It breaks my heart to know that I will never get to see my father again, or to see those I love being affected by it. About 3 years ago the first Death Battle episode I saw in about 6-7 years was Goro VS Machamp, and I was blown away by it. The rundown caught my interest, the fight was well written & animated, I saw Wiz AND Boomstick being animated for the first time ever and I saw right around the corner was another fight that had me hooked. So jump forward to today, and to say this fight was perfect is an understatment. The acting were just like the original cast, the animation while done in sprite animation took the fight into stop motion claymation, 1930's rubberhose animation, the characters own original style of animation and even an actual puppet show! The jokes landed insainly well, the fight itself didn't take itself seriously and the ending was strangely yet befittingly emotional. What I'm trying to say is thank you Death Battle, thank you for being there from my childhood to right now, from the days I'm laughing until I can't see straight to the times we don't see eye to eye, thank you. Also its kind of funny in a morbid kind of way that my father was also named Bill. See you guys next time for the fight between Cole Macgrath & Alex Mercer.

He got trapped for an indefinite period of time and Discord will be drinking tea with Fluttershy, because he will never stand seeing her sad. Yeah, it doesn't even matter how much time Discord needs to be reborn, because his abilities allow him to travel to any point of time, even to the moment of his death, meaning that he can continue the fight right away. Bill was never shown to be fundamentally immortal, just a powerful dude who can, probably, do something. Yet, Bill was shown to be genuinely defeated, while Discord never suffered an actual lose. Both times he dealt with the Elements he allowed himself to get hit, with his abilities allowing him to bury the Elements somewhere in other dimension, would he so desire. So, in the battle scenario of the video we can see Discord simply playing around, trolling Bill and getting his efforts reduced to none. After all, Discord was shown, in the season nine of the show, to not be opposed to drama. He pretended to be wounded by Sombra only to encourage the Mane Six to fight. I think this is the first death battle where the winner arguably lost.  Edit: Actually, thinking about it more I think you missed an important aspect of how this fight would play out. Discord is empowered by external sources of chaos/disorder. We see this first when a couple of fillies get in a fight next to petrified Discord which gives him just enough power to break out. The second time was when he hosted the extremely normal tea party for Fluttershy. By the time they realized being too orderly was harming him, he couldn't even snap his fingers anymore, they just passed through each other. All this to say, Bill Cypher's Chaos Extravaganza would absolutely make Discord more powerful, and fighting Discord would only make things worse.  I am reminded of one of Aesop's Fables, Hercules is traveling along a road when he sees an apple. He stamps on it but instead of being crushed it doubles in size. Legendary battle animation and the best of this season. I disagree with the arguments used and the overall conclusion, however, that doesn't take away from this being an all around amazing episode.  Going into spoilers...  My biggest issue here is that speed was considered to be equalized. Time manipulation does allow for them both to effectively do whatever the hell they want in any timeframe, HOWEVER, it still requires a use speed and showings of them in-character utilizing it that way. And while Bill Cipher has no showings of Acausality or resistance to temporal paradoxes, Discord has shown them.  Now, ignoring the time manipulation, Discord is just... way faster. Bill at his maximum can cross the universe easily, which is super impressive, however his more average showings are significantly slower.  Discord on the other hand casually travelled a week back in time just because he wanted to see Fluttershy.  My second big disagreement is that Bill resists power nullification. The nullifying affects of the shield were depowered in that instance and it had never shown to null people on Bill's level before.  Though I don't even think Grogar's bell should've been used. So that's fine. (There are arguments that Discord can null without it)  Lastly, Discord should have easily became stronger than Bill if Death Battle believes they are equal in that aspect. This is due to the chaos embodiment and empowerment. They mentioned it during Discord's segments but the fight and conclusion just forgot about that I guess.

Here is an idea. Honestly, I think Sailor Mercury vs Blue Ranger Billy is kinda....boring. Not only do their powers clash in a unappealing way as they don't mesh well, even with his era's Megazord, I don't think Billy could do much to Ami. So here is an idea with a character I feel could at least put up a fight.Sailor Mercury vs Tecna (Sailor Moon vs Winx Club)  Ami and Tecna are both of them are young females with short hair. Both of them are the smartest member of their respective groups of magical girls (Sailor Guardians for Sailor Mercury and the Winx Club for Tecna), but are often considered the weakest in terms of raw power. Both of them started off a bit awkward around others, and were a bit anti-social, until they came out of their shells thanks to their friends who they fight alongside. Both of them have some sort of high status of their world of origin (Ami is the Princess of Mercury and Tecna is the Guardian Fairy of Zenith). In addition, the member of the team they are often considered closest to (Makoto Kino/Sailor Jupiter for Ami and Musa for Tecna) are considered the more tomboyish type among the group. In addition, they are the two who's powers are the most varied (Mercury is able use the various forms of water, including fog and ice while Tecna's powers are themed around technology such, like an energy blast called Laser Beam or her defensive barrier, Firewall to name a few). Both also enjoy a good game of Chess.
